it was a nice place to stay.

The listing said it was 15 minutes to the slopes but it's actually closer to 30 minutes.

We had a lovely, authentic experience staying at Maryse‚Äôs cottage. There is plenty of space, comfortable beds, the place has everything you need. Maryse has been very kind, responsive and assistive during our stay. Location is close to Mont Tremblant ski resort. Definitely recommend!

The host was excellent with communication and made check in easy. Will definitely stay again !

Great place with a unique touch to it. You will enjoy the space and the yard outside. It was really dusty and the beds had really weird smells. The room in the basement is practically unusable since it was way too dusty. Other than that, you‚Äôll enjoy it.

This cozy cottage is also connected- on the other side of the street-to the bycicle trail called : Le Ptit Train du Nord. Diehard biker's WELCOME!

reviews.comments: Clean and cozy. The place has everything we need. Rosanna is friendly and supportive. We had a great time here.
Amazing hospitality by Rosanna and a great place to stay in Mississauga.

Excelente, el sitio es muy bonito, c√≥modo y acogedor, aunque la ubicaci√≥n queda a casi a la salida de la ciudad, eso no es un impedimento para movilizarse por la ciudad ya que las opciones de transporte p√∫blico son muy buenas, es f√°cil ir hasta Toronto sin problema alguno, hay sitios cercanos para comprar comida. localizedReview.comments: Excellent, the place is very nice, comfortable and cozy, although the location is almost outside the city, that is not a problem to get around the city since public transport options are very good, it is easy to go to Toronto without any problem, there are places nearby to buy food. The kindness and attention of this place made me feel better than at home, I definitely recommend it.

Newly renovated basement room with two parking space , a shared entrance, located in a quiet Mississauga neighbourhood.

I like socializing with the guests, but if they want your space I respect it.

Public transit such as MiWay, Zum, GO Bus and Train within minutes! 
401/407 Highways exit within 5 min of distance. Metro grocery store and Rexall within 15min away walking or less than 5 min by car. Also, there are shopping plazas located in the area like Premium Outlet, Argentia Smart Centre and Meadowvale Town Centre

name: Yourte mongole au coeur de la f√¥ret

reviews.comments: we loved our stay in catherine‚Äôs yurt! the location is beautiful and peaceful, great for us with our dog, we were able to let her run free and explore. we even saw a moose in the field behind the yurt in the morning! the yurt itself is exceptionally cool ‚Äî definitely a unique experience, with great amenities, all clearly marked and easy to find/follow. there was loads of firewood which was a total bonus, both for the outdoor fire pit and the indoor wood stove. the location was perfect for us to go explore quebec city, and then have a little oasis to return to. unfortunately catherine did not communicate with us during our stay, she did not respond to the message i sent. luckily we did not have any emergencies or require any help during our stay and everything went smooth. she replied with what seemed like a generic response after we had checked out and moved on. that was the only downside to this stay, everything else was great!
Truly a once in a life time experience! It was very lovely and truly felt relaxed. Highly recommend!

We stayed here to break up the long drive from Gaspe to Ottawa.  It was perfect to let the dogs have a good run in the forest after a long car ride and have a great rest in a cozy and non traditional atmosphere.  Plenty of wood available for the stove if one gets chilly and the instructions regarding the off grid components were very clear!
Great place, unique experience!
beautiful and unique accommodations enjoyed our stay and will be happy to come back
Beautifully made Yurt in a quiet space with far more amenities than you'd expect!
Great experience!
Super cool place, and worth a little bit of a drive out of the city.
Lovely yurt, easy to find. Firewood was perfect and the experience was just lovely :)
This is a super cute Yurt! It had more than expected, Catherine has put a lot of thought In making sure guests have what they need. I enjoyed every second and wish I could have stayed longer!

name: Queen Room

reviews.comments: It was a wonderful stay with Lido house, very easy to reach restaurants, grocery stores, I didn't rent a car, you can walk anywhere since it's really close to. It's a quiet clean community and the room is nice and spacious, Lucy is super helpful, if you got any questions just ask her. Definitely will be back!
Great experience
Due to the COVID situation, they do not provide kitchen but microwave. Nice and quiet place. The householder couple are really nice, but the nanna is a little unfriendly though.
Great house to stay!
The house has many rooms and the host was kinda disappointed that we actually made it. She kinda confined us in the room.
greatÔºålovely place
This is a wonderful house.
Good temperature control, not as hot as other Chinese Airbnb place. Private bathroom was nice. Host Kevin was polite. He carried the baggage upstairs
Lucy is friendly and helpful.  The place is modern,  spacy and the location is good. The owner just started with Airbnb and are not very experienced.  The furnishing and decoration can be improved.
Lucy and her husband were so welcoming and friendly!  Very nice people.  You feel safe and they feel both trustworthy and kind.  Great place to hang your head at night!

name: THE FROGTOWN INN, on Haida Gwaii.

reviews.comments: The place was fantastic. Had everything that we needed. Great view with sunset our our front window
reviews.response: I AM GLAD THAT YOU BOTH LIKED THE PLACE. THE HOUSE IS A LABOR OF LOVE. PEACE!

reviews.comments:
7-STAR SERVICE!
As far as hospitality is concerned Vernon went all out!
I showed up solo on a motorbike, and he got his up and running just to take me on a tour and introduce me to some locals.
Place has a great water view & quite comfortable. Ask about camping options too. They are setting up a mobile camper for rent.
All in all, if you're looking for friends on Haida Gwaii you never knew you had. This is the stop!
We'll be back :)

Vernon & Brenda were the greatest hosts. Super friendly and easy to talk to, had great tips for travelling around Masset and even for our drive back home. Would probably say they are one of the best hosts we've ever had! 100% reccommend and 10000% would come back.

Extremely well supplied apartment. Bathtub was much appreciated after a busy day. Travel up the hill to the building is a little challenging. Great stay. My first choice in accommodation in Masset if I return.

We had a little trouble locating the home at first and as I mentioned, we thought it was the home next door(on the highway) we were looking at as the B & B .Just maybe other customers ,not familiar with Masset, may have also. We loved to decor ,the chosen colours on the exterior and the private location but overall
"The View" . Good luck on future construction of the addition !!! Norm
Was such a great experience! Vern was super accommodating and welcoming, offering insight and advice that helped make our trip wonderful. Would definitely recommend to anyone!
It was great to meet Vernon; he's done some really nice work with the Airbnb space and there are more improvements on the way.  The westerly views are fantastic.  I'd visit again!
Not very far out of Masset. Close to town. Beautiful views of the inlet. A very nice stay. Price was very worth it compared to other stays in Masset. Would definitely book again
Vernon & Brenda are very thoughtful, helpful & friendly.   They invited us to go sailing & gather mushrooms, as well as had great info on local spots to check out.

Beautiful sunsets, ocean view.  Very quiet and private. The property was conveniently located a few kms from town and easy to access a variety of cultural galleries, shops and natural points of interests. Vern was very kind, woke up at 1am to ensure that we had a smooth check-in (BC Ferries was late).  Our host was very knowledgeable about the area and recommened some must see spots. Would stay again in a heart beat, absolutely loved Haida Gwaii and had the perfect home base and host for our trip.

photos.caption: Paradise - Marvel at the view looking west over the Pacific Ocean. Explore old growth forests, with monumental cedars that team with life - right out the back door. Listen for echo's of the ancient Haida singing and drumming. Book now.

The early days of  Masset and Reverend Harrison's Rectory,  at the turn of the century. The Rectory was later moved on a log boom up Masset inlet and dragged up the BLUEJACKET ridge to its present location. 

*The original house had only two levels.
Your own private bathroom, with clawfoot tub and shower
A brand new queen sized bed with a new conventional mattress, down pillows and down quilt
Your own private kitchen with fridge and stove
Your private patio with a view of the ocean, viewed through your picture window.
Our location 3 km. south of Masset
Kayak from the front door of "The Rectory" on Masset Inlet
Crossing the inlet from "The Rectory" - The wife and I often paddle across the inlet on calm days.
Black Bear across the inlet behind Maast Island. Black Bear are common here because of the lack of human activity.
Paddling home - "The Rectory" in the background
Maast Island off in the distance
The family dog in the back yard
Coming soon. Wood fired hot tub. Waiting for parts. Lol
I am building an off grid, wood fired hot water heating system from my brain. The system will heat the green house, hot tub and provide hot water to the house.
Boreal forest out the back door - Help save the world's Boreal Forests and get involved.
10 minutes by feet, from the back door.
5 minutes by feet, from the back door.
A "culturally modified tree" 5 minutes from the back door by feet.
Monumental Red Cedar tree, in all it's glory. 2 minutes from the back door. Help save the old growth WESTERN RED CEDAR TREE. Get involved.
Ask about  whale-watching and sightseeing on our sailing vessel.
Ask about fishing charters on our sailing vessel.
Tow hill from our sailing vessel...good halibut jigging, here.

primaryHost.about: I am a woodworker/cabinet maker and woodworking teacher (retired).  My wife and I are avid outdoor enthusiasts, kayakers and sailors. We have lived on Haida Gwaii  for 26 years.

sectionedDescription.access:
Guests will have a self contained main floor suite with a private bathroom and kitchen and access to the hot tub with a view of the ocean.

A $30/day fee will be applied for the use of the hot tub.

We provide a laundry service. Because we collect rain water as our sole means of drinking water, laundry water and fire protection, I DO THE LAUNDRY @ $20 a load.
sectionedDescription.description:
Our home on Haida Gwaii has great views, has a wonderful beach out the front door and an old growth forest filled with wildlife out the back door. You‚Äôll love peace and quiet. 

You will have your own private suite with a private entrance, full kitchen and bathroom. 

Our home is great for couples, solo adventurers or business travelers.
You will love the patio, where you can spot whales pass by and eagles soar.

NEW: Let's go sailing ! - Experience Haida Gwaii by a sailboat. See my ad  AIRBNB

Our house was built as a rectory in 1907 for Masset's Anglican reverend, Charles Harrison and his family. The house has since been moved from Masset to its present location about three kilometers south of Masset along the shores of Masset Inlet.

Guests will have a self contained main floor suite with a private bathroom and kitchen and access to the hot tub with a view of the ocean.

A $30/day fee will be applied for the use of the hot tub.

We provide a laundry service. Because we collect rain water as our sole means of drinking water, laundry water and fire protection, I DO THE LAUNDRY @ $20 a load.

We are happy to assist you in any way we can, during your stay. Ask about sailing tours!

There is only one small cabin in our neighborhood. You are going to appreciate the peace and quiet.

Rental cars are available at National car rentals in Masset. Bike rentals are available at North Beach Surf shop. You can walk the 3 kilometers to Masset. You can paddle a kayak to Masset - That is  my favorite mode of transport!

We are avid kayakers and hikers and have explored Haida Gwaii extensively. We are happy to share our knowledge with others. We will be adding charter fishing and sailing excursions to our list of additional services very soon.

name: Close to Downtown / Restaurants Ê©üÂ†¥Êñπ‰æø

reviews.comments: thank you very much David. it was great stay and I will stay there again when I am in Vancouver. Yas

I definetely recommend staying in this place, description and pictures are 100% accurate, and David answers quickly. It is safe, very clean and organized, and instructions are reliable. Area is nice, safe and located a few minutes walking from metro station with a shopping plaza with everything you need. Metro line takes you quickly to Airport and Downtown.
there are a lots of cherry blossom trees nearby the location and the host's response is quick.

Spacious for one or two, really easy access to the skytrain and bus. Stores and restaurants are close by, leaving in and out was convenient and easy to get back too as well. Anyone looking for an easy in and out place this would be it!

First and Foremost - I did not feel the Room in house was ready for AirBnb guest. It is share -accommodation but very unorganized, The room I stayed - had nothing good besides two dressing drawers ( Guest doesn't use it ). Sleeping Bed was so bad, I had back-pain after sleeping 3 nights. There is no Desk, I could not use my computer.
so all together it was disastrous 3 nights of my stay.
Then - Washroom, 1/2 washroom in the main floor, and Full bathroom was basement - I did not see any towels, I had to ask Amy and David - it took them over 12 hrs to get back to me, I got it from the downstairs by myself.
Kitchen - It was not in order - there are family live upstairs, most of the place preoccupied by the regular I had not any place to put my food, so I keep in my room, I did not cook or use the kitchen, I used to come to get water.
I don't recommend it to anyone.

This was my first place of stay after moving to Vancouver. David and Wendy were super friendly and approachable. The place was accurate to how it was described and it was clean, neat and tidy. I was free to use the kitchen, laundry and living room. Its a quiet and peaceful neighborhood with easy access to trains, buses, banks, restaurants and more.
There were a few guests living here, but I still got a toilet primarily for my use. I also liked how they have environmental friendly products available for guests to use. I felt home at this place and this neighborhood.
David was also happy to provide any recommendations for places to visit and for restaurants. I also got to meet David's little nephew who was visiting once. He was super adorable and made the place more lively haha.
I'm happy I chose this place to stay for my first few weeks in Vancouver. I had a great time. I already feel nostalgic when I pass through this neighborhood haha. I definitely recommend this place!
Great place to stay. Very good location and hoae

Pros: clean quiet space, close to public transportation and airport. Host is prompt to respond. Neighborhood is quaint, quiet and safe, plus there's a coffee shop fairly near by.
Cons: when we arrived late in the evening, we discovered our bed frame was falling apart. During the night, the bed frame slats would fall off and make a loud clattering sound, and the center of the mattress caved in, resulting in an uncomfortable and sleepless night. We contacted the host first thing next day and he was quick to respond and order a new bed frame, but then we had to wait that evening for the new bed frame to be delivered and assembled. A good bed is a must for travel housing, especially after a long day of being out and about.
reviews.response: Hi Vera, glad you enjoyed your time in Vancouver. Thank you for your feedback and we are very sorry that you felt our bed are not well kept. we do value your feedback and will take measures to address.  we have reviewed the unit again in detail for any possible signs of wear and tear. The bed frame was replaced while you and your spouse watched Netflix in our living room.  Thanks again for choosing our unit and we hope you will give us the opportunity to wow you the next time you are in  Vancouver.

reviews.comments: The stay was rather disappointing - quite the opposite of what the listing and photos had promised: the room, washrooms and kitchen were dirty and dusty, with greasy countertops and appliances, hair everywhere, a smelly fridge‚Ä¶ you wanted to spend as little time there as possible. Areas for common use in the house were very untidy with bags, books, toys and other items just thrown into corners and the backyard full of garbage bags. It seems like the property is not well looked after. Unfortunately, the house is poorly soundproofed so you hear a lot when people arrive late or leave early. The bed was also quite uncomfortable so it was not possible to rest well after traveling internationally.
Had a great trouble free time! The place was very clean and quiet, and the hosts were accommodating, available, and informative.

Our house is around 4000 SF.  It has 6 bedrooms total.   3 are available for Airbnb but I advertise them separately so if you want more than 1 room then please email me. There's also a new pool table in the livingroom.

name: Full apartment.  Entirely private in Halifax city

reviews.comments: Great place
Great place üëå üëç

We have just arrived Canada with 4 big suitcases & 4 bags with 7 m baby boy and 2 yr  girl. Halifax housing market is crazy and we couldn‚Äôt find rent so we have to book Airbnb one to another. Mr. Baker was kind let us to check in earlier we appreciate it. But after things getting strange. He entered basement indoor without  our permission he entered while we even didn‚Äôt know he was knocking.Our previous host will go outside around waiting outside and knock the door not just get in inside. We think this is not polite. Although we needed to wash babies clothes but Mr Baker refused to let us do our laundry as this privilege is only for long term tenants. Keep in mind that. The bed wasn‚Äôt comfortable at all we didn‚Äôt sleep well. The night before we check out, Mr. Baker told us we have to clean and leave next morning before 7:30 because there will be guys come to fix the roof. We think it‚Äôs too late to tell us this and we rejected. But we have to leave 10 am in the morning. The day when my wife was cleaning there was a guy just came in and he said the host said the door is opened you can come in and the guy didn‚Äôt even know there were people in the basement. We left much earlier as we were shocked by this attitude. Though the view is really nice and kitchen and living room space is big enough and pretty cozy too. The bathtub tape works in different direction for hot water lol
reviews.response:
First of all, I don't appreciate you giving me negative review and lie about stuff.
You had asked me to turn the heat on and I told you I would when I get home from work.
When I get home I knocked few times on your door until you answered and I asked you if could come in to turn the heat on and you said " yes come in "
I let you check in early at 12 because of your situation although check in time is after 3 and I gave you instructions on how to self check in and you still opened my main house door without even knocking and you scared my mother in law and didn't respect her privacy and you admitted that and apologized few times.
If you don't understand English well, this isn't my problem. Go back and read the messages I sent you. I told you to check out at 10am because you wanted to stay until 3pm and I told you that I have people coming to replace the roof at 7:30am but never asked you to leave at 7:30.
If the worker accidentally opened the door to your place, this is your fault. You should've had the door locked.
I don't care about your review or your opinion as all my previous guests gave me 5 stars review.
Also, if you check my listing details ( which obviously you never did) it doesn't say that washer and dryer are included. It's for my personal use only, not for guests. You even had the nerve to ask me for laundry detergent!!! Go by your own.
You also broke a glass cup and I never charged you for it
I don't want to ever have you as a guest.again

reviews.comments: A beautiful quiet natural setting in a large center (Halifax). Perfect balance.
Great host!
Great communication. Clean. Spacious. Good for the price point.
nice, clean, spacious place in a quiet location. I'd stay there again
the place was very spacious and located in a great area of the city. The host was quick to respond to concerns and the breakfast supplies were a nice touch.

Would definitely recommend this airbnb! It is in a perfect, quiet location. It has a private entrance, nice backyard deck, and a duck pond. Host was kind and accommodating, we had everything we needed, and the place was spacious and clean. We would definitely stay here again!
Nice, spacious and relaxing place

primaryHost.about:
Hello.
My Name is Baker.
I work as a medical laboratory technologist.
I started Airbnb on July 2018.
I'm a family man with three kids.
I have a downstairs apartment that no one is using so my wife (medical laboratory technologist as well) and I decided to Airbnb and give our guests the best we can to make them comfortable and feel like they are home.
We take the extra step to make sure we meet your needs and we are alwaya open for more suggestions to improve.

sectionedDescription.access:
The place includes a full Kitchen with microwave, stove, and fridge. Dishware, silverware and Pots are available if you need to cook.
it also has a toaster, electric kettle, and coffee maker.
Coffee, tea and sugar is provided complimentary.
Breakfast items are included for your convenience.
Big dining table.
Big living room with two large Sofas and  love seat.
Deck and back yard.
Large room with two full size beds.
Private full bathroom with bath tub.
sectionedDescription.description:
Big apartment with full kitchen.
It has a private and secured entrance that over looks a great pond and a walking trail.
Full of windows and lots of sun light.
Only about 400 meters from a major bus route that takes you right to downtown in about 25 minutes.
Grocery store within 3 minutes drive.
Shopping mall and Baye's lake 10 mins.
Very nice and quiet area and very clean apartment. 
Carpet free, Smoke free,  and pet free.
Breakfast is provided.
You will enjoy the stay at this place guaranteed.

We are in the core of Halifax but minutes away from downtown noise :)
Explore the city beyond downtown Halifax! We are nearby many of Halifax's main attractions and being outside downtown gives you easy access to gems such as Long lake provincial park, Crystal Crescent Beach, the Frog Pond, Chocolate Lake, Halifax Shopping Centre, York Redoubt National Historic Site, the Canada Games Centre, and Bayer's Lake shopping area.
Easy access to Halifax main highways.
Pickup and drop off from/to the airport could be arranged depending on work schedule and arrival time with an extra charge of $60 ( less than a Cab fare ).
This place is like home. you will enjoy the big space, view,  breakfast, and the full privacy. 
It is a family home. We live upstairs if you ever need anything
We are very friendly family and can be available whenever you need us for a chat or anything, but we will totally respect your privacy.

it also has a toaster, electric kettle, and coffee maker.

You will get your full privacy, but we'll be available all the time if you need us for information or even a chat.

Very quiet neighborhood. Privacy

Close to major bus route to downtown.
Grocery store, Drug store, Dollar store, and Canadian tire store are about 3 minutes away from the house.
Major shopping places and the Mall are 10 min. away.

- Expect extra charge of up to $80.00 if the place is left unclean.

- If more than Four guests are coming, please contact host to discuss it.
- Guests who do not meet the requirements will have their reservation cancelled.
- I may charge a fee of up to $300.00 if there is any damage to the place, depending on the damage.

sectionedDescription.description:
Welcome to "Home For Now"  Arthur! Your stay here will find you in a private apartment all to yourself. Featuring a full kitchen, but if you don't like to cook there's a family restaurant across the street! Located within a short walk to the downtown core where you will find shopping, additional restaurants, parks, walking trails and more. Parking spot steps away from the entrance and no stairs to climb! Perfect place to stay while you are working in the area or visiting local friends & family!

Welcome to your "Home For Now!" It's a small 2 room, 1 bedroom apartment all to yourself!  Kitchen, dining & sofa area in one room & bedroom with Queen bed in the other, (fold away twin & Playpen also available if needed) Full bathroom and closet also off bedroom. Additionally weather permitting, access to large roof top patio with hot tub may be optional for an extra fee by the hour.  Hot tub times must be arranged before arriving & paid for with host upon arrival. Use is not guaranteed, depends on the weather & hostess availability. Smoking is permitted outdoors only.

reviews.comments: We had a wonderful time at the cabin.  Beautiful lake, very quiet.
It was peace and quiet. The check in process its excellent and the master bed was really comfortable. We appreciate the directions of what to do and where to go
Great stay, as always! Thanks again.
What a beautiful spot.  The cottage has everything you need and is great in any season.  We ended each day skiing with a nice hike around the lake.  Jean-Philippe is a great host.  Excellent stay.

Jean-Philippe's chalet was the perfect home base for our family's annual ski trip to the area. We arrived to find a lovely welcome gift of local delicacies, as well as wood ready for the fire. We immediately felt right at home, and had a fantastic stay. We hope to return - merci beaucoup, Jean-Philippe et Alexandra!
We enjoyed our stay - loved the wooded path that went along the lake.  The camp was clean and comfortable and had everything we needed!
comfortable place.  Jean Philippe was a very good host. very close to the wineries.
cozy rustic cottage right on the lake. very peaceful & private.
Amazingly cozy and relaxing. The place is much more beautiful than what it shows in the pictures. Will definitely go again!
Overall, I had a great time. The place was clean and the view of the lake quite nice. My dog did enjoy kayaking. I would not hesitate to rent again this cottage.

reviews.comments: We stayed at Charlotte and Vera's special cottage for almost a week over Christmas with my extended family, including four kids and 6 adults. The cottage is beautifully decorated with stunning views and all the amenities that make for a comfortable stay. We were welcomed with a kind welcome gift and Vera even contacted me ahead of time to answer all of my questions. Vera was accessible and responsive and incredibly helpful throughout! The rooms were all perfectly equipped with spectacular views. The kitchen was large with plenty of room to cook big dinners nightly. The hot tub was a great outdoor activity on lazy days. We discovered some nearby walks that were great for kids, although mostly had to drive to those areas. The kids loved the room with bunk beds and there were plenty of toys to occupy them, including a piano. The cottage was decorated for christmas with a tree and festive touches. We loved our stay and really enjoy the family time in the comfortable and calming space. We would love to go back and highly recommend! This place would be perfect any time of the year!

Great cottage with shallow sandy waters that's super safe for kids. a lot of activities to keep the kids busy. the cottage was well stocked, super modern and clean. It also has a lot of windows keeping the cottage full of brightness and overseeing Lake Simcoe.
No comment
Absolutely amazing accommodations! Spectacular setting with stunning views! It was the perfect place for a quick get-away...our only regret is not having booked a longer stay.

An absolutely stunning place with the most beautiful view of the lake.  Quiet and secluded it was the perfect place for our kids to enjoy the snow outside and play multiple games inside.  The piano inside was a perfect place for our daughter to practice while we were away!  The infloor heating and tasteful Christmas decorations made our winter escape all the more wonderful.  We enjoyed a delicious meal from a recommended restaurant just up the street.  And no better way to enjoy the holidays with a soak in the hot tub.  Such a beautiful place that we can't wait to book this again!

Having travelled through countless AirBnb‚Äôs with small to very large groups ‚Äî this place was not only special because of the view and the actual cottage, everything was in consideration from heated floors, patios basically in each room, outdoor shower, 3 restrooms, everything you need to have a big dinner, canoe, kayaks, hot tub and many more!
I‚Äôd highly recommend this place and it‚Äôs worth every dollar. Thanks Charlotte and Vera! ‚ú®üôåüèΩ
Beautiful cottage, great views, would book again!

This property is truly special.  The accommodations themselves are absolutely perfect... amazing views, gentle breeze blowing in from the lake in the evening, fireside patio chats, and the lapping waves truly take you away to another world.  Charlotte's place here is as clean as a bell and has everything you could want for a memorable group stay with a very luxurious feel.  The sandy bottom lake is a delight for swimming and we had no trouble enjoying our days at this slice of heaven.  Highest unconditional recommendation.

With stunning views, this beautifully appointed, well laid out, spacious luxury lake house was exactly what my family needed. Charlotte has done a wonderful job providing everything that you need for a relaxing family vacation. The property is in a great location and she provides so much for your family to do - boats, kayaks, floating mat, convenient lake access and endless places to relax and enjoy. The house is immaculate and decorated beautifully. It really is a great getaway. Her prompt response to any inquiry was much appreciated. I would definitely recommend it and look forward to visiting again.

My family and I rented this beautiful cottage for 4 nights and could have not been happier. The place was clean, modern and 4 families loved every minute of it. Our infants were accommodated. The kids had plenty of water toys. The cottage is absolutely beautiful and surrounded by water. The lake is clean, warm, private and great for relaxing. Shallow with Soft sandy bottom that you can walk on. I give this a 5/5 plus plus plus. The cottage is modern, spacious and luxurious and it has everything you can think of. From every corner of this property one can hear the waves and enjoy the views of Simcoe lake. The hosts are great folks and we‚Äôre answering any questions we had with in minutes. Everything was just perfect. The pictures show how amazing this place is but one has to stay here to see and feel the beauty and luxury of this property. Thank you for an amazing experience and we will be back soon.

sectionedDescription.access: This will include complete access to the cottage, other than a few closets and kitchen cupboards  which will be locked with personal items.
sectionedDescription.description:
Instagram @lakesimcoebeachhouse

NEW  SUMMER 2022 Availability!

Our nautical, all season beach house offers stunning, spacious living . Windows in every corner allow beautiful all exposure ‚ÄúCaribbean‚Äù views that are just as stunning from the inside, as outside (offering sunrise and sunset). Situated on a point with 185‚Äô frontage, a hard sand bottom & sand bars, you can walk out 200m from shore- perfect for kids to play and adults to enjoy. Ride  2 tandem and std bikes for your delight!‚Äù

Instagram- @lakesimcoebeachhouse

Summer 2022 availability!!

The cottage is equipped with all of the essentials you will need, including; coffee, tea drawer, spice drawer, oil, vinegars, towels, kitchen essentials (blender, toaster, mixer, dishwasher, oven, stove, Keurig, popcorn maker, coffee maker, teapot, panini maker, utensils, pots & pans), a BBQ, kids lake toys , huge 6x20 Lily Pad , canoe, 2 kayaks, paddle board, paddle boat, noodles, 2 tandem & other bikes! Whether you are interested in complete relaxation or kayaking, canoeing, paddle boarding, swimming, biking, hiking, there is certainly something here for everyone to enjoy. 

Situated on a beautiful point (with 270 degree views), the cottage offers both stunning sunsets along with morning sun streaming into a wall of windows.! 

Please note we now have a year round HOT TUB and an OUTDOOR SHOWER  ( not operational Nov- March) to wash off those beachy sandy feet! Come and indulge yourself in the ultimate ‚Äú Caribbean‚Äù location on Simcoe!  

Interested in a professional photo shoot of you and your loved  ones/ friends while you are here? We can arrange the most beautiful photos for an additional fee ( based on availability) Check out charvanamphotography.ca

705-791-3819 to inquire about  all inclusive INTIMATE WEDDING rental details  for an additional fee. Please note a wedding rental is in conjunction with our highly sought after In House Professional Photographer, Charlotte.

This will include complete access to the cottage, other than a few closets and kitchen cupboards  which will be locked with personal items.

BEFORE BOOKING please CONTACT US on air bnb platform or at 705-345-8517 to discuss. 

OFF SEASON  our space is available for 4 night minimum rentals. A minimum 7 night rental applies HIGH SEASON June to Sept.  At Christmas, and March break a min. 5 night rental applies. Please contact us if you have interest in days that are currently blocked off. U can also DM at Lakesimcoebeachhouse for more pics and info

The cottage is located just on the outskirts of Lagoon City, known as the Venice of Ontario! A very cute ‚ÄúFlorida vibe‚Äù area, with many small roads, parks and walking  and driving bridges crossing the canals. This is a wonderful place for walking and bike riding exploration along country lanes and roads that hug the beautiful Lake Simcoe shoreline. This has been identified as a world class area for spectacular kite boarding that can be viewed on windy days right in front of our cottage . How about paddle, boarding canoeing, kayaking or lazing on our lily pad?

Interested in ice fishing, skating , x- country skiing or just walks on majestic Lake Simcoe or canals? These are all possibilities right on the lake... literally 10‚Äô from our patio doors!!( weather dependent of course)

The neighborhood is fantastic for walking, running or hop on our 2 bicycles built for two( as well as other bikes) and scoot around beautiful canals or hug the Lake Simcoe  shoreline  for a beautiful ride!  Just bring your helmets! Minutes by foot around the corner is an amazing Italian restaurant and market called Lanterna ( take out and catering available)  We also now have Sunset Sushi that will deliver right to you! A 4 minute drive to Wild Wing, and the nearest grocery/LCBO and drugstore for anything you might need! We are a 20 minute drive to Casino Rama and 25 minutes to Orillia, a city of 35,000.

Please note we have an easy step in large shower especially wonderful
for any elderly guests. This is located in the master bedroom with ensuite. A second step in shower ( though with a little threshold) is located on the main floor. 

If you have a small, non- shedding, crate trained dog  that stays off furniture and remains only on the  main floor strictly away from  bedrooms, we can discuss. Otherwise, absolutely no pets permitted.

This cottage is kept immaculately clean as our guests attest to in reviews.

Interested in learning the fabulous sport of kite boarding on water or ice/ snow? Ask us. What about heading out ice fishing in your own personal hut ? You will be picked up right at our door and pulled out to your fishing hole that is ready for you. Just ask and we will make arrangements for you
sectionedDescription.houseRules:
‚Ä¢No shoes in cottage.  
- Rinse sand off in outdoor shower before entering

‚Ä¢No smoking/ Vaping in or outside on property

‚Ä¢Please remove all food and opened condiments brought into the cottage (ketchup etc).

‚Ä¢Please wash any used dishes and If using dishwasher EMPTY and put all dishes away  before leaving please

- Place all dirty towels in hampers provided

- no need to make beds. Please remove all used sheets and pillow cases and place in laundry hamper. 

- all garbage to be placed in appropriate containers in garage. For longer  stays, garbage day is Tuesday morning. Have garbage set at roadside- not driveway.  We will notify you whether garbage or blue-box.  Green bin weekly. 

‚Ä¢Turn furnace down to 60 degrees upon leaving or in hot weather turn AC to 74 .         
-All downstairs outdoor cushions to be brushed off and placed behind living room couch. Back of loungers to be flattened so wind cannot blow them.              
    Lock the cottage padlock when leaving please.

name: Newly renovated peaceful home in central Richmond

reviews.comments:
Yaniv house is clean and tidy, quiet zone for living.
Yaniv replies asap for all questions.

Yaniv and Michael's place is one of the cleanest places that we have visited. All the beds and bathrooms are spotless (As SuperHost on Airbnb, we have keen eyes for cleanness).
The beds are very comfortable, so all 7 of my travel group members had great sleep.
The kitchen is very well stocked, and they provide all kinds of cooking wares with tons of ingredients.
The WIFI is fast, hot water with strong water pressure, strong hot air heating in the living area combined with quiet heating in the bedrooms.
The location is great. 10 mins drive to Richmond town center with all signature restaurants and other fun activities.
The house feels bigger than the pictures and our favorite area is around the electric fireplace, warm and quiet, separated from the rest of house (where we left to our noisy kids).
Though they are new hosts on Airbnb, we can strongly feel the great efforts and thoughtful touches from all above details.
5-star recommendation from a fellow SuperHost.

sectionedDescription.access:
Guests have access to all areas of the house and surrounding property except the garage.

The home entrance is secured with a combination padlock for self check-in. It will have a temporary individualized combination set for the duration of your stay, and reset at checkout.

Driveway and street parking are both available and free.

The home exterior is monitored via security cameras.
sectionedDescription.description:
Newly renovated 4-bedroom / 3-bathroom detached home. 
Welcoming, clean, and peaceful newly furnished home in a quiet suburban neighbourhood in central Richmond.

15 min drive from airport, 11 min bus to city centre, 5 min walk to local amenities and bus stations.

Bedrooms have queen beds, dedicated work space, storage, heating, and air purification. 
Bathrooms are stocked with essentials. 
Living room 4K TV has Netflix and Prime Video. 
Kitchen is fully equipped.

4-bedroom 3-bathroom detached home. Welcoming, clean, and quiet.

- BEDROOMS all have a queen size bed with cotton bedding & down comforters, a working space, storage, heating, and air purification.
- BATHROOMS are stocked with the essentials, and have ample hot water. The primary bathroom has heated floors and new tiles for a luxury experience.
- KITCHEN is fully equipped with fridge, freezer, range, microwave, dishwasher, toaster, microwave, coffee maker, pots & pans, full set of 8 dishes and cutlery, appliances, heated floors and bar-stool seating.
- LIVING ROOM has brand new sofas and a new 55" flat-screen 4K UHD smart television, with streaming-services included (Netflix & Prime Video).
- DINING ROOM comfortably seats eight people for a cozy meal.
- GARDEN has a patio with a gas BBQ, perfect for a private and tranquil retreat. In the summer months enjoy fresh organic blueberries, pears, apples, plums, and figs grown in the backyard for you to pick.
- LAUNDRY ROOM has a washer and dryer, and stocked with supplies.

The home is newly renovated and newly furnished.

Guests have access to all areas of the house and surrounding property except the garage.

The home entrance is secured with a combination padlock for self check-in. It will have a temporary individualized combination set for the duration of your stay, and reset at checkout.

Driveway and street parking are both available and free.

The home exterior is monitored via security cameras.

I recently fully renovated this house, turning it into my first and only Airbnb. 
I took great care to make sure the house has brand new floors, appliances, kitchen and bathroom fixtures, with a code-locked doors, and an automatic vacuum/moping robot. 
I will give you as much space as you would like, but if you need anything please don't hesitate to ask. 
I live within 5 minute walking distance and am available for assistance at anytime.

The home is centrally located in Richmond, BC in a quiet and secluded residential neighbourhood away from road traffic.

The House is a 5 minute walk from Blundell Centre, where you will find a grocery store, drug store, farmer's market, a few banks, several shops, and a variety of cafes, restaurants, and bars.
We are 15 minutes by car from the airport, and 11 minutes by bus from the city centre and the main train station to the downtown core or the airport. 
There are several bus stations within a 5 minute walk serviced by either the 402 or 407 lines.
There is ample free parking for guests with a vehicle.

Kids of ages 2+ are welcome, but we do NOT supply a crib, safety gates for stairs, or child-locked storage for cleaning products and other things with safety risks.
sectionedDescription.houseRules:
- We like to keep our space clean, comfortable, and safe for all guests. Therefore, we ask all guests to be respectful and keep the home in the same condition when checking out as it was when checking in.

- The house is located in a quiet residential neighbourhood. Please respect the neighbours and keep noise levels at a minimum from 10pm - 8am, in accordance with the community bylaws.

- There is NO SMOKING or vaping permitted inside the home. Smoking inside is subject to a $200 fine per day. If you would like to smoke, please do so outside and discard your butts respectfully so as to not leave extra work for the gardeners. Violating this rule by smoking inside the house may lead to immediate eviction with no refund. If your smoking leads to our next guests cancelling, you will be responsible for that loss of booking.

- NO PARTIES/EVENTS, NO VISITORS, NO PETS. Registered guests only. Please make sure to review your information and update the number of guests before booking. Having unauthorized people or pets on the property can be grounds for the immediate cancellation of your stay without refund.

- Please remove your shoes when entering the house.

- Rinse and load all dirty dishes into the dishwasher and put all used towels and slippers in the blue laundry hamper (in front of the washing machine) before checking out.

- Heavily stained or missing towels will be charged $30 per towel.

- All 3 showers can be used at the same time. If hot water runs out please wait 30 minutes to allow the hot water tank to refill.

- We are unable to provide flexibility on the check out time. A charge of $100 dollars per hour will be made in accordance with our cleaners if the guests fail to satisfy this rule.

 - If you have any questions or issues please contact us so we may fix the problem as soon as possible.

Thank you and enjoy your stay!

reviews.comments: If you are visiting Oka this is a great place to stay. Very cozy and has everything you need. Beautiful surroundings.
Clean, cozy, comfortable.  A nice  getaway.  Amazing location for a walk or hike.
Wonderful space, terrific location and outstanding host (who is also extremely responsive).  Would absolutely recommend and would also return here if in the area.
Stephanie's place is in quiet neighborhood near hilly trails that lead to an broad view of lakes and trees. It was clean, with all the amenities needed. I would recommend this to anyone in the area.
Lovely place and great value
Stephane's place is an immaculate and private basement apartment.  A lovely setting and we would have no hesitation in highly recommending it to Oka visitors.
Perfect for a snowshoeing/cross-country ski trip. Right around the corner from Oka park and very comfortable and convenient!
We spent a weekend visiting the Oka National park and stayed at Stephane‚Äôs place - it was just perfect! I would strongly recommend staying there!
So clean and comfortable. Will stay again in next trips to Oka

Super host!!
Absolutely clean, friendly and helpful.
Great surroundings.
Highly recommendable.

name: Luxe family friendly house near subway

reviews.comments: goof stay

Had some renovations being done at our home & checked into this Airbnb for a month. It looks just like the pictures & it's very spacious. Check in was very easy, host was very responsive & location is great, 10 mins walk from Finch subway station. Kitchen was well equipped to make meals. Towels & linens were provided. Thanks for letting us stay at your huge home!

Really enjoyed staying at Christie‚Äôs place - great location and the ensuite bathrooms were a big hit to accommodate our big family. The place is spacious and modern and had all the amenities we needed for our stay.

Christie has such a beautiful home. My family flew into town for a few days and I hosted them here, and the loved everything about this place. It was so spacious and comfortable , It really was a home away from home. My family did not want to leave lol and neither did I honestly! Christie was a awesome host very punctual , responsible and respectful. She is honestly so sweet and accommodating and I can‚Äôt wait to stay here again in the future !
A huge, beautiful clean new house in a location that is walkable to the subway and many restaurants.  The host is responsive to any questions and helpful.

Amazing stay for families visiting from out of town. The place was perfect, it‚Äôs beautifully designed, super clean, and very thoughtful with the amenities provided.  The location is also very convenient. Thank you for such a great stay!
reviews.response: Thanks Betty - it‚Äôs my pleasure hosting you and your families! Happy holidays!

reviews.comments: The home has so much potential to be beautiful and perfect.  I originally booked as a staycation so I could host a virtual event for my charity and my kids could remote learn.  I arrived solo for the first day and the house was not clean, let alone pandemic clean.  There was lipstick on a duvet, random hairs on the bed, the bathroom sink by the drains were not cleaned and the floors were sticky.  I did let the owner know and she acknowledged that she didn't have time to clean, however $850 for cleaning is a bit much.  I never once let my kids come by and I just hosted my event from 11-5:30 each day.  I even checked out early.   The price per night is good for the assumption for what your getting, however I would never stay here again.  Truly wished this was a maintained home and not a shell of a home for parties.  I was really hoping for a staycation with my family and somewhere for them to have a great time while I worked, and instead, they stayed home with the nanny while I worked. (At home I don't have the same square footage to work remotely and privately, hence why this place seemed ideal). The owner did reimburse me $50
reviews.response:
Hi Michele,
As a host I always welcome feedback from my guests - thanks for letting me know your experience about the stay. Unlike many professional hosts, I am the owner of the property and i take every booking very seriously. Since it‚Äôs a public review, I feel it‚Äôs necessary to make some clarifications.
First of all, my house rule does not allow any events/parties and I try my best to prevent it - so please rest assured this is definitely not a ‚Äòhouse for party‚Äô.
There must a misunderstanding in our message - Prior to your arrival, my regular cleaning lady was unavailable but my husband and I spent more than 6 hours to clean the whole property myself, and I took 4 minutes video afterwards. All cleaning follows Airbnb enhanced cleaning protocol. After reviewing the footage, I did not see anything dirty in any of the sink/floor. Apologies that you found a stain on duvet - we can only wash duvet but not bleach it. The cleaning fee purely reflects the market rate for 5000 sq ft interior plus a huge front and backyard.
Lastly, thanks for pointing out that my place is truly a bargain based on pricing - I will adjust it accordingly.

reviews.comments: Amazing house! The best place I have stayed at in Toronto hands down.

Wenjing is a wonderful host! Very responsive and kind. The home is absolutely beautiful and far more beautiful in person. The rooms are HUGE. If you are  looking for a large spacious home, very reasonably priced, this is it. It's very clean, and even though it's not near the heart of the city, there are plenty of essential things around. It's a nice short walk to a huge park and the area is very quiet.
Amazing!

sectionedDescription.description:
Welcome to this 5000 sq ft, custom built family home on a quiet street next to North York center
Steps to Subway station, parks and countless restaurants
Centrally located within city, easy commutate to 401, Pearson, Yorkdale Mall, Toronto Zoo, Canada‚Äôs wonderland
Patio furniture and charcoal BBQ in fully fenced backyard with an Organic garden
Spacious home office, 4 oversized bedrooms with 4 ensuites
4 parking spots
Using only natural cleaning products
PLEASE read house rule before booking:)

Whole house and backyard

A large part of North York, Willowdale is an affluent community centred around Yonge St. from Steeles Ave. down to the 401, and from Bayview to Senlac Rd. It has gained in popularity as its amenities continue to grow and new condo development changes its landscape. It's prized for being located on the subway lines, and offers easy access to all parts of the city.

Being a perfect blend of suburban and urban, Willowdale offers the best of both worlds. Willowdale is sometimes distinguished between its eastern and western parts and the vibe varies depending on where exactly you are in the neighbourhood.

Subway station is about 8 minutes walk. There‚Äôs a bus station at the corner of Finch and Talbot about 1 minutes away. 4 parking spots in total on site.

There‚Äôs an elevator in the house. Due to high maintenance costs and supply issues for the parts, please use the elevator only when necessary.
Property is protected with outdoor security cameras and noise monitoring sensor. 
Thanks for your understanding
sectionedDescription.houseRules:
Dear future guests, thanks for your interest in booking my house! There are a few things I‚Äôd like to share with you before booking, please read through carefully:                                                     This house is located in a residential area so Parties/events are strictly prohibited: 11pm - 7am is the quiet time as per city of Toronto bylaw. Any kind of smoking (cigarettes, shisha, marijuana etc) inside the property is strictly prohibited.                                                                       As per insurance policy, all guests 18+ will need to provide their full name, and the guest who made the reservation. I will need to verify ID at checkin. Guests are responsible to bring out the relevant waste bins to the curb for collection every Tuesday - details will be provided at checkin.                                                                      Due to high maintenance costs and supply issues for the parts, please ONLY use the elevator when necessary - I will check and make sure elevator is working properly before checkin, and guests will be charged for damage repairs ($200/hour for labor plus parts).                                 
Please keep thermostat within reasonable temperature range and there‚Äôs a boundary setup on the thermostat-No more than 22 Celsius under Heat, or lower than 23 under Cool. There is a sensor installed to monitor noise, temperature and humidity level on top of elevator door frame. There are also 4 outdoor security cameras.                                                 
The cleaning fee charged is for regular cleaning. If you require a deep cleaning service (ie light fixtures, door and window frames, base board, disinfect small appliances, blinds etc), please let me know before checkin and there will be extra charges. 
Please let me know ASAP if you spot any water or gas leak. Guests will be asked to pay for utilities due to extravagant usages after checkout.                 I‚Äôd like to host good behaving pets - please message me before booking with details of the pets. There will be an extra $350 charge for deep cleaning and insurance.     Please respect checkin and checkout schedule. Early checkin and late checkout can be accommodated on most occasions for $100 - Please let me know in advance. If guests checkout late w/o notice there will be an extra $200 charge.  Thanks for your understanding!
sectionedDescription.name: Luxe family friendly house near subway

It has gained in popularity as its amenities continue to grow and new condo development changes its landscape. It's prized for being located on the subway lines, and offers easy access to all parts of the city.

Being a perfect blend of suburban and urban, Willowdale offers the best of both worlds. Willowdale is sometimes distinguished between its eastern and western parts and the vibe varies depending on where exactly you are in the neighbourhood.

additionalHouseRules:
Dear future guests, thanks for your interest in booking my house! There are a few things I‚Äôd like to share with you before booking, please read through carefully:                                                     This house is located in a residential area so Parties/events are strictly prohibited: 11pm - 7am is the quiet time as per city of Toronto bylaw. Any kind of smoking (cigarettes, shisha, marijuana etc) inside the property is strictly prohibited.                                                                       As per insurance policy, all guests 18+ will need to provide their full name, and the guest who made the reservation. I will need to verify ID at checkin. Guests are responsible to bring out the relevant waste bins to the curb for collection every Tuesday - details will be provided at checkin.                                                                      Due to high maintenance costs and supply issues for the parts, please ONLY use the elevator when necessary - I will check and make sure elevator is working properly before checkin, and guests will be charged for damage repairs ($200/hour for labor plus parts).                                 
Please keep thermostat within reasonable temperature range and there‚Äôs a boundary setup on the thermostat-No more than 22 Celsius under Heat, or lower than 23 under Cool. There is a sensor installed to monitor noise, temperature and humidity level on top of elevator door frame. There are also 4 outdoor security cameras.                                                 
The cleaning fee charged is for regular cleaning. If you require a deep cleaning service (ie light fixtures, door and window frames, base board, disinfect small appliances, blinds etc), please let me know before checkin and there will be extra charges. 
Please let me know ASAP if you spot any water or gas leak. Guests will be asked to pay for utilities due to extravagant usages after checkout.                 I‚Äôd like to host good behaving pets - please message me before booking with details of the pets. There will be an extra $350 charge for deep cleaning and insurance.     Please respect checkin and checkout schedule. Early checkin and late checkout can be accommodated on most occasions for $100 - Please let me know in advance. If guests checkout late w/o notice there will be an extra $200 charge.  Thanks for your understanding!

name: Largest two Bedroom Suite  at Glacier Lodge.

reviews.comments: Our family had an excellent time in David's condo.  It was large enough for a family of 5, perfectly located with plenty of locations to visit and a short, beautiful walk to the Lower Village.  We hope to be back again next year! Thank you

Great stay for a bike park vacation. Easy bike storage. Big rooms. Prompt communication. Our pack box on top of the car means we had to park in Lot 5 but it's only a 2min bike ride. Will be back next year.
BOOK THIS PLACE!! Very spacious, very clean and a fantastic location!

What a perfect place to call home while in Whistler. 2 kids + 2 adults and we had plenty of room. Well appointed, comfortable and spacious 2 bedroom. We prefer Blackcomb as it's quieter/less of a scene, but it's a quick 6 min walk over to Whistler, so perfect location for us! David was great. Super responsive and helpful. We can't wait to come back and will definitely stay here again!

Great place!! We had 2 adults and 3 kids and we had a blast.  15 min walk to main village. We walked back and forth all day. No issues. Pool was great. 2 hot tubs. Sun not crazy after 3 or so in summer. A little hot but fans do the trick!! Loved it!!

David‚Äôs place is great for a ski weekend in whistler. One minute away walk from the Blackcomb gondola. Can comfortably sleep multiple people as there are two bedrooms and two pull out couches. Additional single foam mattress was also an option too. Also having a hot tub outside is a bonus.
Great place to stay. Very ideal for access to the mountain and the village. I would definitely stay here again!
Great place in a great location!

David's place was clean, spacious, and well equipped. And a great location at the base of blackholm, just steps to the gondola and an easy stroll to the main village. David was very responsive and easy to work with. Great place, would totally stay here again.

You will not find another Airbnb on Blackcomb that beats the convenience and value of this condo. Everything you need is within walking distance, and amenities inside the unit like the fireplace and heated floors really make this Airbnb feel like home. Can‚Äôt wait to stay here again

sectionedDescription.access: There is complimentary ski storage in the winter and complimentary secure bike storage in the summer. The unit has shared laundry available on the same floor of the Glacier Lodge.
sectionedDescription.description:
My renovated ski-in/ski-out unit is the largest condo within the luxurious Glacier Lodge. This spacious unit is in an unbeatable location in the heart of the Upper Village and a few short steps away from the base of the ski hill. There are restaurants, a ski rental shop, a liquor store and a spa within the building.

The unit has 2 large bedrooms, 2 full bathrooms, and a 2 large pull out sofas. The kitchen is well stocked for those looking to enjoy a relaxing night in. Unwind in one of two hot tubs and a pool which are open year round.

There is complimentary ski storage in the winter and complimentary secure bike storage in the summer. The unit has shared laundry available on the same floor of the Glacier Lodge.

If you have any questions I am always available by phone.
While the front desk does not manage this unit  (cleaning or supplies) they are usually available to answer general questions and help out as any hotel front desk.

Around the building within a very short walking distance includes groceries, golf courses, the Lost Lake pathway system in addition to numerous hiking trails.  It‚Äôs a great place for couples looking for a getaway as well as families with kids looking for a large place to facilitate memorable adventures.

Whistler transit  just outside the  hotel.  Whistler lower village is an easy 11 minute walk. For most things whistler is a walking village.  Taxis are also available.

The unit does come with a sampling of coffee, and some basic condiments for convenience.
sectionedDescription.houseRules:
Skis and Bikes are to be stored in the parking level or the concierge service.

If there are dirty dishes at the time of check out please run them through the dish washer (it is okay to leave dishwasher running) it is nice to not have to clean dishes after guests leave but we understand that sometimes time will slip away, do your best to leave the place clean.  

We wash all sheets (including duvet covers) and linens after you leave. You are welcome to strip the sheets and leave them in the bathroom with the towels. 

There is recycling and  garbage in the parkade level P1

We do not have an official policy on consuming the liquor that is in the unit when you arrive, we want you to feel at home. Sometimes our guests leave beer or wine, feel free to consume it if it is in the fridge. It is suggested that if you do take one, you may wish to pay it forward and  replace it for the next guest. 
Leftovers and opened foods (except condiments) are generally cleared out of the fridge, however this unit is used by our family so there may be items that are left for future use.

reviews.comments: Thank you Lucas for everything, the apartments are just wonderful, everything is as in the photo, clean and comfortable.  Within walking distance of everything you need, shops, restaurants, banks and metro.  We were lucky and from the apartment window we could see fireworks for the New Year.  In case of any questions, Lucas was always in touch and was happy to help.
Lucas was the best host couldn‚Äôt of asked for a better host. I‚Äôm a international traveller he made us feel welcome. Thank you next time I come back will definitely stay there again

It was really great to stay at Luca‚Äôs place. He goes above and beyond to make your stay comfortable and always answers within a few minutes when you communicate with him. This place is in the heart of downtown, you can walk anywhere, the harbor is five minutes walk and provides great unwinding after a busy Toronto day. Unlike other downtown  condos, Lucas place is quiet, no street sounds and very quiet Neighbors. My family and I would definitely stay there again. I would definitely recommend this condo to anyone wanting to stay in downtown Toronto!
reviews.response: Thank you Joelle for your positive 5star review, I'm glad your family had a good time in Toronto!

reviews.comments: The condo was incredibly clean.  The location and view were great.  100% would stay here again and would while-heartedly recommend!!

This condo is situated near a variety of food, drink, and museum offerings. You can park your car and be out all day without ever using it again - a wonderfully walkable location! The two bathrooms were a nice accommodation for four people.
Great location in downtown Toronto, near to everything you will need.
Lucas‚Äôs place is in a great location, he‚Äôs great at getting back to you and the place is lovely. I‚Äôll be back!!!
Great place to stay and close to union station. Has everything you need and the location makes it super easy to get in and out of the city.
Everything was great!
Great location and very clean!

sectionedDescription.access:
Your new condo will be all yours for the duration of your stay!

sectionedDescription.description:
Experience Toronto in your newly decorated, prime location condo that's right downtown and surrounded by world-class amenities! Uniquely-local things to do right at your door including great restaurants, nightlife and family friendly experiences. 

Please send me a message to help make your Toronto visit a success!

Did you just get a last minute cancellation? message me right away and I will help!

*Min. 28 day stay

Your elegant new place is freshly decorated and double-deep cleaned to perfection! Located in Toronto's top tier location for Business, Leisure and Family Travel due to it's prime spot next to the Entertainment district, CNtower and local Business towers for Amazon, Tellus, IBM and more. Your  condo is next to Union Station for Subway within the city, GObus for the Greater Toronto Area (GTA), and train station for beyond. immediate attractions include Scotia Arena, Rogers Centre and Metro Toronto Convention Centre, locally known as the MTCC!

Smart-Home enabled with:
‚Äî High-Speed Gigabit Wifi
‚Äî 55" Smart-tv 4k UHD
‚Äî Smart Lock for easy home access

DoubleDeep Cleaned for a Sparkling clean stay! 

Enjoy your Luxurious new condo located in the Toronto--core and equipped with:
‚Äî Fluffy cotton towels
‚Äî Luxurious thread-count sheets, fluffy pillows and throw blankets
‚Äî Properly furnished kitchen, ready to use with Keurig/Nespresso coffee maker and tea kettle 
‚Äî Large grocery and alcohol retail location across the street with easy access

Recharge your energy on the huge balcony with a calming, peaceful view of the courtyard, green-grass canopy and nearby water feature in the summer time!

Your new condo will be all yours for the duration of your stay!

Access:
#Arriving from inside the City of Toronto:
‚Äî take subway and/or street car to union station (next to your condo)

#Access from Pearson Airport:
‚Äî Taxi or Uber (30min)
‚Äî UP train (25min+2min walk)

#Access from Billie Bishop Airport:
‚Äî Taxi/Uber (5min) 
‚Äî Shuttle Bus will bring you to union station, next to condo

Host is available should you need help via call/message otherwise will respect your privacy for a productive/relaxing stay in Toronto!

Experience the City like an authentic Toronto--nian in your sleek, prime location condo that you will have all to yourself! Home is perfectly situated in the city-center by the harbourfront and next to the Metro Toronto Convention Center, near patio eateries, events, and pedestrian markets. There is exquisite dining, and uniquely local things-to-do with sight-seeing right at your door!

Your Condo is situated near: 
‚Äî Metro Toronto Convention Centre
‚Äî CN-Tower with 553 meter-high view of the city all the way to Niagara falls 
‚Äî New Harbour front/Waterfront redevelopment with skating and summer/winter carnivals
‚Äî Royal Ontario Museum with international reputation for excellence 
‚Äî Rogers Centre, the Olympic domed sports arena 
‚Äî Art Gallery of Ontario with special exhibitions 
‚Äî Castle Loma showcasing European elegance and splendour 
‚Äî St. Lawrence Market housing variety of vendors selling many unique speciality items ‚Äî Toronto Entertainment District, for major theatre production with live plays
 
Host's Fav Restaurants
‚Äî Good burgers: E11even
‚Äî Chicken wings: Real Sports Bar (2min walk)
‚Äî Alcohol: LCBO (across street)
‚Äî Mexican & Guac: La Carnita
‚Äî Mexican & Tacos: Seven Lives
‚Äî Greek Food: Mamakas on Ossington and Christina's on the Danforth
‚Äî Shawarma/Donair: Donair Kebab House, get extra sauce!
‚Äî Lebanese: Lebanese Express
‚Äî Steak house: Jacobs

Most food in Toronto is excellent, above are only some options!

Your condo will be all yours for your stay. 

Arriving from Pearson Airport:
‚Äî Taxi/Uber (30min)
‚Äî UP train (25m+2min walk)

Arriving from Billie Bishop Airport:
‚Äî Taxi/Uber (5min)
‚Äî Shuttle will bring you to union station, next to condo

Arriving from inside Toronto:
‚Äî take subway and/or street car to union station (next to condo)

Minimum of 28 day stay

Private underground parking available (inquire for monthly pricing/ seasonally dependant); or pay per use parking nextdoor.

Please remember you're staying in a private condo. Guests have access to condo amenities but please note that there are some closures from time to time.

Additional costs:
- Early check-in at 2pm $150
- Late check-out at 1pm $150
sectionedDescription.houseRules:
Please read House rules prior to booking.

The Guest that booked the reservation shall be responsible for the property aswell as the liability for all peoples or pets present at the building property, in the condo unit and balcony for the duration of the reservation and any extension thereof. 

Finalizing a booking shall mean that the Guest accepts the house rules and shall abide by them.

Guests must briefly speak with concierge and show ID matching guests ID upon their arrival (note concierge will not assist in check-in) as there is increased security screening for all people entering the building to deter trespassing, please book how many guests you anticipate to have on the property (not just sleeping over). This is a very secure building. Please note security may not allow someone not registered into the property. 
- Remove shoes in home
- Check-in time is 4pm-11pm (with flexibility, early check-in with fee may be available)
- Check-out time is 11am (for cleaning, not flexible)
- No smoking, except on balcony with door/window closed, if any smell of smoke in condo, Guest agrees to pre-set smoke-cleaning fee of $599
- No parties or events/loud music, please be courteous to residents living in building (Toronto has a noise by-law, no loud noise after 9PM, you may be ticketed if there is a complaint)
- Please be considerate to all rules and regulations in place by condo management as they take it very seriously!
- No extra/outside guests other than registered with airbnb, no pets, no drugs
- Parking available please ask for current price (no visitor parking)
-pet fee $499/stay (non allergenic only please) , must advise at time of booking, last minute pet at check-in will not be accepted
-In the unlikely event that there is an eviction, Guest agrees to pay an eviction fee of $500.00
-regarding parking at condo and on premise: charges are for use of designated parking space only, host/condo not responsible for any tickets/towing as a result of parking in the wrong spot. Host/condo corporation shall not be responsible for loss or damage to car or contents.
-smart TV allows for you to use Netflix with your own password
- Have a wonderful time and I will do everything I can to provide a great stay!

- Check-out time is 11am (for cleaning, not flexible)
- No smoking, except on balcony with door/window closed, if any smell of smoke in condo, Guest agrees to pre-set smoke-cleaning fee of $599
- No parties or events/loud music, please be courteous to residents living in building (Toronto has a noise by-law, no loud noise after 9PM, you may be ticketed if there is a complaint)
- Please be considerate to all rules and regulations in place by condo management as they take it very seriously!
- No extra/outside guests other than registered with airbnb, no pets, no drugs
- Parking available please ask for current price (no visitor parking)
-pet fee $499/stay (non allergenic only please) , must advise at time of booking, last minute pet at check-in will not be accepted
-In the unlikely event that there is an eviction, Guest agrees to pay an eviction fee of $500.00
-regarding parking at condo and on premise: charges are for use of designated parking space only, host/condo not responsible for any tickets/towing as a result of parking in the wrong spot. Host/condo corporation shall not be responsible for loss or damage to car or contents.
-smart TV allows for you to use Netflix with your own password
- Have a wonderful time and I will do everything I can to provide a great stay!

name: Oriana: A Beautiful, Luxurious, Elegant Yacht

reviews.comments: Mark was an outstanding host, his generosity and hospitality is just unparalleled. The 3 days on Oriana were awesome and Mark, with his intimate knowledge of the Gulf Islands, was just the perfect host, friendly, always available and thaught our young ones how to govern the boat. Mark took us out to all his favorite places (will not forget our pre-dinner at Smitty's) so we had a perfect experience. He and his entire crew were going all the way to make our vacation special and the trip on Oriana was certainly the highlight of our trip. Kyle, the great chef, did everything to tease our palates and Hank was just great with the young ones taking them out for tubing. In short: we had a fantastic time and will come back. Heinz

I had a remarkable time on the Oriana and getting to visit Vancouver. Mark is an especially gracious host and he takes great care of his home on the water. The stay was incredible, getting to see impressive views of Vancouver and resting and relaxing in a truly unique boat.

The oriana is everything you imagine it to be and more. From the minute you arrive to the minute you leave, you're in for an adventure! Hank Hill is one of the crew members on the oriana and he is absolutely amazing, he's great with kids too!

What an incredible experience. It was a privilege to spend a few days on such a splendid yacht. The Oriana is beautiful boat. The crew was superb and  a pleasure with which to cruise the Inner Passageway.  Food was to die for.  Will definitely be back for more. Already looking at schedule for next year.

I can only say good things about my stay: Mark was an amazing host - very kind and easy to work with. The location is epic (hello, sunrise breakfast and sunset cocktails). The boat is spacious, comfortable, and beautiful. Definitely the most memorable and special airbnb experience I have had.

sectionedDescription.access: We offer first class car service from Vancouver airport or nearby location in the comfort  and luxury of a Rolls Royce Ghost.
sectionedDescription.description:
Wake up to the most beautiful view in Canada!  

Aboard Oriana, you can expect sumptuous luxury, impeccable craftsmanship, seamless service and a world class experience. 

Oriana can accommodate up to eight guests and each stateroom is tastefully decorated and designed for maximum luxury and comfort.

The Master Stateroom has a king sized bed and vanity area with a large ensuite. The three guest staterooms each have their own private bathroom. 

Whether you prefer formal dining, alfresco lunches, or sundeck barbeques, our world class chef will cater to your preferences to not just produce exquisite meals, but to produce those meals in keeping with your specific tastes in mind. Fresh seafood and local produce are readily available, making dining onboard Oriana a truly unique experience.

For your onboard entertainment, there is WiFi, satellite television and Sonos surround sound system throughout the entire yacht. We have a wonderful Grand Salon, a classic martini bar and an elegant dining room which seats ten.

We offer first class car service from Vancouver airport or nearby location in the comfort  and luxury of a Rolls Royce Ghost.

We are docked in Vancouver and can take you anywhere on the coast of British Columbia.

Transportation is provided in a beautiful Rolls Royce Ghost.

We also carry two jet skis, two electric bikes, a waterski tender, paddle boards and other water toys.

We offer four crew and up to six, if requested.
