name: Log cabin muskoka.

reviews.comments: Amazing stay in the woods just outside port carling. cabin was well equipped and house was super clean. our host Jason was very responsive and lovely to communicate with. myself and two other people stayed for one month for work and it was a great experience. highly recommend.

We enjoyed a wonderful visit with family visiting from Switzerland in this beautiful and interesting log home.  The place is spacious and well designed for a combined family.  We enjoyed having two bathrooms.  The open kitchen design allowed ample room for cooking, eating and relaxing together.  We love the surround veranda where our grandson could ride his little coaster bike and we could enjoy outdoor meals together despite the drizzly weather.  The wood burning stove was a great feature.The bedrooms provided new firm mattresses and lovely bed linens.  We enjoyed  the the BBQ and fire pit area most evenings.  Our host Jason and his local manager were available to answer our questions without delay.  This is a bright, cheerful home with a very interesting and well though out design.  We will plan to come again for future family time and look forward to see how Jason will develop the landscaping as it is quite rugged at present.
Cabin and location were beautiful.  Quick and easy communication with the host.

We stayed in the last weekend of January 2022. It also happened to be the coldest, -17C to -24C.
The roads and driveway was very good, cleared of snow. The driveway is up hill and with snow tires, the front wheel drive Mini Cooper had no problem.
We slept well and it was warm with the supplied bedding.
The cottage was newly built, clean and well stocked. It also had a BBQ and an outdoor fire pit ready for use.
The owner and property manager dealt with our concerns and communicated promptly.
The location was very convenient a supermarket 8 minutes away.
We (4 adults) lived normally during Friday night to Monday morning without any electrical power issues there was sufficient solar battery power.
I was new to wood stove fireplace but the property manager showed me how to use it and worked really well. ( had unlimited wood by the front door)
We brought our own sleeping bags and sat on the huge wrap around porch and also walked around the property in knee deep snow.
I would have given a full 5 star but in the interest of air bnb users in which we rely on for transparent and honest our reviews I am pointing out a couple things.
There was a couple things but made an impact during our stay. I have full confidence they will have them rectified for the next guest.
The well water supply pipe into the cottage had frozen during-24C temps and was given options. I opted to stay and with no running water and use bottled water (supplied). We made it work our, choice.
The cottage being a new build and the foundation settling, as explained to me by the property manager, bottom corner had a slight gap which I was okay with.
The cottage was well built, well insulated with modern technology.
However I did not notice until the last night of our stay that there was a cold draft coming in from the bottom corner which explained the dining room and living room feeling colder than the rest of the the cottage. Once I plugged the draft with paper towels, it made a huge difference. Why I didn‚Äôt think it sooner my bad.
Also bring your own indoor slippers to keep feet warmer.
Overall we are satisfied with our stay in lieu of the above issues that was out of the owner and property managers control.
It was how they communicated us with transparency and taking ownership of the issues and trying their best to improve counts.
I would book this off-grid cottage again planning to book in late February or early March.
We would also definitely book in the fall my favourite time of year.
Thanks Jason and Chris
Great place to spend our winter vacation! The wood stove was so great and kept the cabin very warm! The town is adorable and only a few minutes away. Perfect for an off grid get away!
Great place. very quite and nice. Highly recommended.
Awesome place, surrounded by woods, nice fire place and breathtaking star gazing

Amazing place to spend your holidays! Highly recommend, huge property with no neighbours around, great cottage for all purposes
Enough space to accommodate 8 people!
Definitely booking it again!

sectionedDescription.access: You have full and unlimited access to the whole house and property. The house is on a quiet  cottage road. Feel free to explore the property, you can find a map with the property boundaries clearly listed.
sectionedDescription.description:
Find yourself in the heart of muskoka.  While staying on the peninsula between the two lakes (Lake Joseph and Lake Rosseau) you‚Äôll never find yourself far away from water.

Off grid log cabin which sleeps eight on 15 acres of land.  

The house consists of two bedrooms downstairs with a bathroom, the upstairs is like a loft but really it‚Äôs just a big open room with a private bathroom.    The upstairs bedroom is not separated by a wall but is still private. 

There‚Äôs lots of space at the top of the hill to park your car, you could even bring a trailer with a boat or in the winter your sleds.

You have full and unlimited access to the whole house and property. The house is on a quiet  cottage road. Feel free to explore the property, you can find a map with the property boundaries clearly listed.

Feel free to contact me anytime during your stay.  You can reach me per email. Jasoncs@web.de

The town of Port Sandfield. is just 2km down the street where you can find a public access with very shallow beach on the south side, which is ideal for young swimmers.   Also in Port Sandfield. you find a General store(SilverStream farms), with an ice cream parlor,  a Marina (Port Sandfield Marina) with boat rentals, and a boat ramp.   

If you like golfing then you‚Äôll find yourself an ideal location, Lake Joseph Club they are almost our neighbours.   Port Carling Golf & Country Club, Muskoka Lakes Golf and Country Club.  Also just five minutes north of us you‚Äôll find the hamlet of Minett where you can  find The Rock and Pine Ridge golf courses.

The best way to get around is by car but you‚Äôre more than welcome to explore the back country roads by bicycle or by foot.   We like to go for a run in the evening down to the Port Sandfield bridge and have  a swim.

Like you‚Äôve already read the house is an off grid house and sometimes the generator might come on to top up the batteries, but other than that you‚Äôll never lose power even if the rest of Muskoka has a blackout.
sectionedDescription.houseRules: Electric cars are great but don‚Äôt charge at house, it‚Äôs an off grid house. The power comes from the sun.  Do not drive vehicles off of the driveway as you might damage the septic system, this also applies to winter and snowmobiling, remember that snow insulates the septic lines.
sectionedDescription.interaction: Feel free to contact me anytime during your stay.  You can reach me per email. Jasoncs@web.de

name: CAPE ESCAPE

primaryHost.about:
Hi there, thanks for stopping and wondering who is behind these residence rentals? It's me Matt. 

As a host, it is vital to me that you have a memorable experience and an enjoyable stay.  I started out as a customer‚ÄîI've travelled to a number of different countries and have stayed in a number of different suites‚Äîso I know how important it is to provide a great place to stay. 

A little about me: I studied business and health in Canada, Sweden and Iceland. Once completing my education I became a partner in Oceanstone Resort, Premiere Self Storage and Moore Suites in Atlantic Canada. This past year I spent eight days in Sierra Leone, Africa helping to raise awareness of the need for clean water and toilet facilities. 

Some of my favourite travel destinations are Iceland, Norway and Barbados.  I think the best part of travelling is meeting new people, making new friends and learning about different lifestyles.  
  
  
 
Places lived: Sweden, Denmark, Iceland, Canada
Languages spoke: Swedish, French

sectionedDescription.description:
Truly spectacular one of a kind nine bedroom estate with oceanviews that have been considered by many to be the among the best in Canada.  Features include Indoor Gym, pool, dock, 2 guesthouses, wine cellar, hottub, indoor steamroom, billiards room

This one of a kind estate has a commanding presence at the end of Chester's treasured Peninsula, overlooking the Atlantic Ocean yet is private and serene. The elevated panoramic views towards, the Golf Club, the Aspotogan Peninsula, the islands of Mahone Bay, Big Fish, Clay, Meisners, Quaker, the Tancooks, and beyond, are simply spectacular! The colorful gardens and pathways offer several peaceful vantage points to enjoy both sunrises and sunsets. With 3 acres, 800' of waterfront, a 130' wharf, two double garages with guest quarters and more, this home has been meticulously designed and constructed for one family. 
Over the years Mary MacDougall's designs have contributed tremendously to the welcoming embrace of this home, from the gym spa with steam room, the dream kitchen with Aga stove, to the cherry paneled study, and everything in between, the smallest detail is in place. The master suite with dressing room and ensuite is beyond compare. With 6 guest bedrooms, and games / media / pool rooms, everyone will be entertained. All the principle rooms open to the waterside decks. 
The village of Chester offers the best sailing on the east coast, a seaside golf course, Playhouse, Art Centre and more on Nova Scotia's Bluenose Coast, an hour from Stanfield's International Airport.

The village of Chester offers the best sailing on the east coast, a seaside golf course, Playhouse, Art Centre and more on Nova Scotia's Bluenose Coast, an hour from Stanfield's International Airport.

reviews.comments: Had a great stay for labour day weekend. The campground had tonnes of activities and amenities, we also enjoyed the boardwalk shopping and treats. Scot had great clear timely communication and had everything ready for us when we arrived.  It was clean. We loved lounging out and having fires. My four year old had a blast we will be back :)

Scott was an amazing host. He kept an approprate level of contact. We knew he was there if we needed him.
There was wine and firewood as advertised and Scott dropped off more firewood halfway through the trip. We had more than we could burn.
The layout of the camper was very nice and clean. The kids felt like they really had their own space. But we spent most of our time in the amazing outdoor space. It is very private and there are plenty of seating options.
There was an air conditioning unit in the main area of the camper and fans in the two bedroom. We didn't need the fans, but it was nice to have the choice.
The camper had everything we needed. We were surprised to find a microwave and a Keurig! There were plenty of dishes and utensils, but we used paer plates to cut down on chores.
They use a hot plate and electric walk instead of the stove/oven. We had brought our own air fryer (a request from the kids) and mostly used the BBQ, so this didn't impact us much.
The campground bathrooms are a stone's throw away, are very clean and have showers. These were preferred over the camper bathroom.
We didn't get to spend as much time exploring the campground as we would have liked. There were just too many things to do and they were all so very close. We did enjoy the lovely pool one night. We had it almost to ourselves.
Sandspit, the beach and Shining waters are all really close. Amazing location!

The trailer was exactly as advertised. Scott was very easy to work with and everything went smoothly. We loved the location In the campground, especially being right close to the washrooms and showers.

My daughter and I loved that it was close to all the attractions.  The lot was large and felt private in the gazebo and fire pit area. Campground had lots to keep my 5 year old busy and entertained. We had everything we needed to make the trailer comfortable during our stay.

Accomodations were so close and convenient to everything. Quick drive to Cavendish beach, sansdpit and walking distance to the boardwalk.  The kids loved the pool on site as well.  Check in was easy and communication was great! Loved the wine on check in, very nice touch!

As a family with two young kids, we really enjoyed our 3-night stay. Scott was always available for anything we needed, and the wine was so very welcome! The trailer has A/C and fans in the bedrooms so it wasn‚Äôt too stuffy. The yard outside is where we spent our time once the kids were down. Lovely decks and fire pit with a gazebo if the bugs are out. Thanks again Scott for making it work for us!

What a wonderful stay in Cavendish. Right across from the National Park.
Though the area is very touristy, it does mean you have lots of services around.
The resort itself is nice in that we found it quiet, pool if wanted, great playground and always activities going on. The washroom/shower house right across from the unit was fantastic and no need to even use the facilities inside the unit.
The unit was plenty big, nicely redone and everything you needed including coffee maker, fire roasting sticks, toaster and everything in between. Newly added AC was nice to cool the unit in the day, but we went to windows in the evening for fresh air.
As for our host, he was absolutely awesome. Scott cared for us just as much as family. Met us at a good time, showed us the unit and fully willing to do a full tour. Answered any of our questions quickly. Checked in everyday to make sure we were ok, low on anything and generally just having a nice vacation. He was a pleasure to deal with and one of best hosts we have ever had.
Highly recommend this unit, even if our not the camping type. Scott will make sure you have a nice stay.
Location, value, amenities were awesome! Scott was available anytime and checked in on us to make sure everything was ok and we had everything we needed. Thanks Scott!
Great location in the park, next to clean washrooms, showers & laundry.  Lovely little camper, we had a great time in PEI!
Perfect place, I recommend it

name: Serene Scene - Duplex - Walk To The Falls

reviews.comments: Cute and cozy. Really close to everything.
Adam's place was just as described.  It was clean, in a quiet residential neighborhood.  Would definitely stay at his place again.

The communication with Adam was excellent and the apartment very well described.
It seems to be a rather historical building which to us absolutely had its charme, especially due to the radiators that were back in the days designed with nice decor.
We got the impression Adam wants his guests really to be comfortable and if anything would not meet expectations (e.g. a former guest would not have cleaned a dish properly) he would have come over to fix it.
The stay was good. Only concern is on the general cleanliness. Some of the key places were not dusted enough especially the common room was not  dusted. Also, the coffee table and sofa.

Overall I had a good stay at Adam's place. There were few issues, like I could not lock the door to the washroom, the lower door hinge was coming out and the door was just hanging on one hinge. I could not opened the windows, because he has installed window AC, which makes a lot of noise and it is impossible to sleep while they are on. I like natural fresh air while sleeping during the night. I have an electric car and Adam let me use one of his outdoor plugs to charge it, which was really nice of him. Overall I would recommend Adam's place. It was walking distance from main falls attraction.

Location, Location, Location‚Ä¶  Great local restaurant near by, 15 min walk to major attractions, calm and relaxing place to stay at a adventurous day, accommodating and good enough for the price . If you want a calm, relaxing and close by place next the attractions,  you found your place.
Close to the Niagara Falls
Great location from the falls, off street parking. It had the basics for a quick one night stay.
Great place to stay in Niagara Falls! The place was clean, cozy, quiet and only a short walk to the main strip. Adam was a great host too.

Adam‚Äôs place is a short walk to the tourist area, Clifton Hill. The neighborhood felt safe and was quite peaceful. Adam responded quickly to any questions we had and provided us with everything we needed to have a great stay.

photos.caption: Spacious Living Room With 55" Smart TV

primaryHost.about: I'm a real estate agent with a hobby for collectible stuff and I also rent out property. I absolutely love auctions, playing guitar, and reading. If you're ever interested in buying or selling property in Niagara I'm your guy for that too!

sectionedDescription.description:
Beautifully decorated fully private upper unit in a fully remodeled century home in a quiet neighbourhood in Old Niagara just steps away from everything you want to see! Casino Niagara is a 10 min walk. Clifton Hill/attractions that Niagara has are located close by.  Enjoy all comforts of this serene home including a spacious living room with 55" smart TV, newly renovated bathroom and kitchen, while you explore our beautiful city!

Remodeled fully private second floor apartment in a 2 apartment home. The pictures describe it best!

Have you tried Airbnb? Sign up with my link and you will get up to $95 CAD off your first trip. https://abnb.me/e/aLqlCDLHsib?suuid=2211c967-ee73-4428-a418-6ee112e752f6&slevel=0

Full access to the private upstairs apartment and front patio.

The neighbourhood is a quiet one in Old Niagara, there are many character homes. It's a 10 minute walk to the tourist area.

Niagara falls is one of the safest cities in the world. Walking is a good way to get around. Uber is also usually available.

This is not a party home. The neighbourhood is generally quiet and it's expected that guests also respect this. When there is more than 2 guests, each guest will be charged a rate of $25 per guest per night.
sectionedDescription.houseRules:
HOUSE RULES:

This is not a party house. Absolutely no parties or unreasonable noise past 10pm. This is a by-law in the neighbourhood and respecting the neighbours is highest importance. If there are any noise complaints, you will be asked to leave immediately. 

The proper amount of guests staying will need to be entered when you book. There's one bedroom per couple. Other bedrooms will be locked and supplies will be available depending on the amount of guests on the booking. Extra guests will be counted and charged afterwards if the amount is not correct. The after booking fee is $40 per guest per night above 2 guests and there will also be an added administration fee of $40 for making the change during or after the stay.   If there is a change of the amount of guests staying at any time before or during the booking, it must be communicated to the host. 

Please make sure all your garbage is placed in the proper receptacles. This includes items that you've used that you'd otherwise leave on the tables, countertops or floors.
 
Absolutely no smoking in the house. If a guest smokes please do so outside provided you dispose of the waste. Smoking or excessive cleaning in the home will be subject to a $300 cleaning fee.

Washing all dishes and placing back are the guests' responsibility.

Please don't touch the windows that have do not touch signs on them. Top windows can be opened. Also do not touch the bottom kitchen window. If you want to open the kitchen window only open the top window.

Do not touch the water radiator heater knobs or anything that helps the heater function. This may result in water spilling through the house and to the first floor. 

Check out is 11am. Late checkouts will be subject to a $40 fee each hour past check out. Checking out means vacating the property, not just leaving the apartment. 

If there are any issues at all with the place then contacting me is highly suggested and appreciated. Thanks! Adam

name: Charming 1BR ski in ski out with pool, hot tub.

reviews.comments:
Don's place is conveniently located on the premises near amenities, and within short walking distance to the Creekside shopping center and lots of other restaurants and spas. The space is clean and exactly as shown in the photos. The lobby is also spacious and a nice place to do puzzles, read, or hang out. The swimming/hot tub area has a change room and showers and a separate sauna area, which was a nice surprise! There is also a full barbecue set up in the shared court yard that guests can use. The kitchen has lots of appliances and cooking vessels with a great seasoning rack, but bring your own cooking oil if you'll be dining in. Also bring your own tea and coffee (one pot of coffee is provided on arrival).
Don is also a great host. He gave a lot of clear and helpful information upfront, and checked in once we arrived. He was quick to respond and I was confident he'd be available if we needed anything (we didn't - everything was great!) We would love to come back soon!

We had a great stay, just a short walk to the gondola, enjoyed the outdoor shared but large hot tub for relaxing after a ski day, and a comfortable space to stay in. Had everything we needed and instructions were clear and helpful.

We love Don's place and would love to come back during our future ski seasons. The place is very close to Creekside village gondola. Don provided everything we need with clear instruction. The pool is also great and very easy to access from the room. It was just perfect :)

We would happily stay in Don‚Äôs place again. The check-in instructions were clear, he provided us with great information, and he was responsive with communication. The place was very clean and we absolutely loved the convenience to the Creekside Gondola. Creekside was a nice area to be away from the bustle of the main village.
Don's place was great! Exactly as described. Parking, location, ease of access, etc. were all great. I'd definitely stay again.
Great spot, easy access to gondola, many amenities available. Don was very friendly and helpful!

This is our second time staying at Don‚Äôs place. It‚Äôs comfortable, relaxing and has everything we need. The kitchen supplies are well stocked for cooking full meals. You cannot beat the location. Don is a great host!
Great spot right across from a  gondola that takes you half way up the mountain. Perfect for the skier/snowboarder.
Fantastic location to get to the Creekside Gondola. Condo was clean and easy to find. The setting was beyond incredible in Whistler Creekside.
I recommend staying here if you like skiing, heated pools and hot tubs! What a great spot for a fun weekend

A warm comfortable living room. To the left is the patio door which leads onto the private deck. Just 50 feet from the deck is the pool and hot tub.
A fully equipped kitchen for your convenience.
The bedroom features a queen bed, bureau and full closet.

sectionedDescription.access: Leave your car in our free secured underground parking, a saving of up to $30.00/night plus tax compared to other places in Whistler. Across the street from The Lake Placid Lodge is the Creekside bus loop for both local buses into the village and the airport shuttle.
sectionedDescription.description:
Welcome to the Lake Placid Lodge, located at the base of Whistler's Creekside gondola. A warm and cozy one bedroom suite on the quiet side of the building offering views into the courtyard. Enjoy our year-round heated outdoor pool, sauna, luxurious hot tub and BBQ area. A one minute stroll takes you to Franz's trail, Creekside's shopping area that offers a grocery store, liquor store ,restaurants and more. A suite perfect for a family vacation or a romantic escape.

Summer rentals:This is a particularly nice suite in the summer. The suite is on the garden level facing into the courtyard so you have only to step off the suite's sundeck and walk over the grass yard to access the pool, hot tub and BBQs.

Leave your car in our free secured underground parking, a saving of up to $30.00/night plus tax compared to other places in Whistler. Across the street from The Lake Placid Lodge is the Creekside bus loop for both local buses into the village and the airport shuttle.

The Lake Placid Lodge offers one of the best locations in Whistler. A one minute walk takes you to the Creekside gondola or to Franz's trail, Creekside's car free shopping area. The Creekside Gondola base is away from the village bustle but still offers ticket sales, a ski school booking desk, rentals, repairs and guest services. Dusty's, voted several years running the best apres in Whistler is where you click your skiis off.There are at least nine restaurants within easy walking distance including Tim Hortons. You can choose from quick take out right up to fine dining at the Nita Lake Lodge or the Rim Rock Cafe.

Included in your booking is free parking, a saving of up to $30.00/night. Right across the street from The Lake Placid Lodge is the Creekside bus loop for both local buses into the village and the airport shuttle. Shops, ski lifts and ski rentals are also just across the street.

Some of the best dining options in Whistler are a short walk from the Lake Placid Lodge. For fine dining, try The Red Door Bistro or The Rim Rock Cafe but make reservations in advance. For casual dinning, try Creekbread (best pizza in Whistler), Roland's pub, Samurai Bowl and the lounge at The Nita Lake Lodge.
sectionedDescription.houseRules:
- Minimum 25 years old to book the property.
- This is a family complex, please be considerate. Noise will not be tolerated after 10PM.
-  Will be fined and possibly evicted for excessive noise, bringing a pet into the building, common and private property damage, after hours pool jumping, disturbing the peace or exceeding the number of allowed guests in unit(four). No refund on the balance if evicted.
-Although open now,  the pool/hot tub may be closed without notice due to covid safety concerns.
-Strata rules prohibit smoking or vaping in the suite, patio or any common areas. If you smoke, you must do so off the property.

sectionedDescription.access: Self Check In
sectionedDescription.description:
This award-winning Chalet is truly exceptional and unmatched by any others at Big White. Opulent, luxurious, beautifully designed with incredible 270-degree views, an amazing home with every imaginable feature you could wish for.  Suitable for large families or groups with arguably the best Ski In/Ski Out location on the mountain. Comfortably sleeps up to 16 with 6 bedrooms all of which have their own ensuite bathrooms. There is also a separate self-contained Nanny suite.

The Chalet features a large great room combining the living and dining rooms and kitchen together. Surrounded by windows and a wrap around heated outdoor deck with covered outdoor seating and gas heaters. Huge Gourmet kitchen with professional series appliances and top shelf equipment any Chef would be thrilled to work with. 

The lower floor boasts a dedicated theatre room with 10 reclining chairs and a large movie screen with surround sound for an amazing viewing experience. If you are not watching movies you can play a game of pool or table tennis , enjoy a drink at the large full bar or relax in front of the wood burning fireplace. After a long day of skiing you may prefer to relax in the Sauna or have a soak in the outdoor Hot tub overlooking the ski run. On a cool night you might prefer to bundle up around the outdoor gas fire pit surrounded by glass to keep the wind out and keep you warm. 

 All the electronics throughout the home are state of the art with a smart home built in entertainment system controlled by various iPads terminals in the home. The Chalet backs right onto the ski run for easy access to the lifts. Gear up in a large heated boot room which has plenty of space for all of your gear and rows of boot/glove dryers to keep your equipment warm and dry for the next ski adventure.  Plenty of parking available with two heated spots in the garage and additional parking in the driveway for more if needed. The owners have spared no expense creating this immaculate property to ensure their guests have an unforgettable experience!

Self Check In

Luxury Mountain Vacation Rentals are the on-mountain resort representatives for our property. They look after our guests and take great care to ensure you have an unparalleled ski vacation experience! It is important to us that our guests have access to on-mountain expertise and support to make certain they have the most memorable ski vacation. We know you will be in good hands!

The Chalet is located at the top of the Feathertop Development nestled between The Bullet and Black Forest Chairs. Arguably the best ski in/out location on the mountain. The Chalet backs onto Sundance Ski Run.. right out your back door! Easy access to the Village via the shuttle or a short 10 min walk away.

At the entrance to the Feathertop development you will find the Shuttle Bus stop for the bus that takes you to and from various locations on the mountain. Alternatively you can walk down the development road to the Bullet Alley Cat Track. This is a walking path that is light up in the evening for guests to wander to the Village or down to Happy Valley where you will find the Gondola. Here you can catch the Gondola up to the Village Center.

name: Manoir Maplewood

reviews.comments: AMAZING place, exactly as described!  Beautifully decorated and very very clean. Bedrooms, bathrooms and kitchen were spotless. There were 12 in our party and we fit very comfortably. We loved exploring the place. When we were home we spent most of our time in the very spacious and cozy kitchen.  We rented it NYE weekend to ski at Bromont and it was perfect. Only 15 minutes to the mountain and very easy to get to. Some local eateries nearby and we ate in Bromont too.  Louis our host was very responsive and patient with all our questions. We took beautiful pictures in the home and hope to stay here again.
An absolutely gorgeous house and yard!

primaryHost.about:
Founded in 2000, Whistler Platinum is an exclusive property management and luxury accommodation company, providing homeowners with unrivaled property management, and guests with exceptional accommodation, vacation planning, and personalized concierge services. Our mission is to go above and beyond, making home ownership easy, and our guests‚Äô vacations memorable.

As our guest, you can choose to experience some of Whistler‚Äôs finest homes with an unsurpassed level of service and care. Our team work, live, and play in Whistler every day, bringing you the very best Whistler has to offer. Our Travel Advisors make booking a vacation home easy, and tailor your stay with those little extras to make it perfect. Prior to your arrival our team cleans, inspects, maintains, and prepares each of our homes to our high standards. And our local Guest Experience team welcomes you on arrival, seven days a week, 365 days a year.

If you‚Äôre ready for a stress-free vacation, then Whistler Platinum is ready for you!

sectionedDescription.description:
Welcome to the grand Serenity Estate. This impressive ski-in/ski-out home is perched high above the valley in the exclusive Kadenwood neighbourhood.

Welcome to the grand Serenity Estate. This spectacular ski-in/ski-out home is perched high above the valley in the exclusive Kadenwood neighbourhood, tucked amongst the cedars on the south side of Whistler Mountain. Serenity Estate captures the natural surroundings and welcomes expansive panoramic views through floor-to-ceiling windows that envelope the residence and bring the magic of Whistler's wilderness into every room.

Unwind in 5800 sq/ft of living space, including two impressive master suites plus four additional bedrooms - all complete with ensuite bathrooms. Curl up in front of the fire, entertain in the chef‚Äôs kitchen with a separate butler‚Äôs pantry or enjoy a movie or game of pool in the media room. Watch skiers pass by as you unwind on by the fire pit or in the hot tub. Serenity Estate is truly a mountain gateway and offers the convenience of a private gondola, biking and ski access trails, and all within close proximity of Creekside and Whistler Village.

Living Areas

Serenity Estate allows nature to take center stage with floor-to-ceiling windows that welcome an abundance of natural light throughout the outstanding living areas on the main floor. From the spacious open-plan main living area, take in breathtaking 180-degree views of Whistler valley; from the local Creekside Gondola to Whistler‚Äôs largest Lake, Green Lake, and everything in between.

The home has no shortage of spaces to chill out. Kick back and watch your favourite series in the den featuring a 65 inch TV, surround sound and gas fireplace. Get carried away with your most recent page-turner in the spacious, glass-enclosed reading room and office featuring a large bookcase. When it‚Äôs time to relax, apr√®s in style with a beverage while you soak in the alpenglow from the impressive cantilevered hot tub or stay warm by the fire pit. Enjoy a beverage from the wet bar while you play a game of pool or take in your favourite movie on the projector in the media room.

An entertainer‚Äôs dream home, Serenity Estate features everything you need for a dinner party with family and friends. The gourmet kitchen features a large center island bench and modern appliances including an integrated refrigerator and freezer as well as three Gaggenau ovens. There‚Äôs a prep kitchen for your private chef to prepare delicious meals that will leave you wanting more. Take in the view from the dinner table with room for ten, or dine alfresco in the outdoor living area.

Bedrooms & Bathrooms

Step inside the master bedroom and be blown away by the spectacular views offered by the floor-to-ceiling windows extending over two walls. Wake up to these views every morning from your king-size bed or enjoy them from the deep-soaker tub in the master bathroom which also features a double vanity and glass shower. On this top floor you will find three more bedrooms, one with a queen-sized bed and ensuite, and the other two with two twin beds that share a bathroom.

Continuing onto the bottom floor there is an additional bedroom with queen-size bed and ensuite with a deep-soaker tub and separate glass shower. Finally, in the furthest bedroom there is a bunk bed wall that can comfortably sleep four children. The room includes plenty of closet space and its own bathroom with deep-soaker tub and separate glass shower.

In addition to these private bathrooms there is a powder room on the main floor behind the living room and kitchen. This impressive home can easily sleep 10 guests with a maximum occupancy of 12.

Added Conveniences

The home‚Äôs steam room offers the perfect place to relax and rejuvenate after a day on the slopes. Store your ski and snowboarding equipment in the large ski room, complete with boot, glove and helmet dryer to warm your gear for the day ahead. A two-car garage and large private driveway offer up plenty of space to park your vehicles.

Location

This home is located in Whistler's Kadenwood neighbourhood, an exclusive ski-in/ski-out community that is surrounded by spectacular old-growth forests and provides access to its own private resident's gondola.

Things to Know

Booking requests. Please note that we do not offer instant booking on this property. Online bookings are considered booking requests and will be subject to review.

Ski Access. Ski-out access to the Lower Peak to Creek trail is available a short walk from Serenity's entrance and is weather dependent. The closest ski-in access is near the top of the Kadenwood Gondola. Ski access typically begins in late December and ends in March. The Guest Services team can confirm snow levels shortly before arrival.

Construction in Kadenwood. As one of the newer neighbourhoods in Whistler, several homes remain under construction in Kadenwood. The homesite next to Serenity is under construction. Construction is typically active from 8 am to 5 pm but is permitted from 8 am - 8 pm. Guests may experience construction noise from machinery, cranes, other construction-related vehicles and workers. During the summer months, we include a construction discount at the time of booking as compensation for any disturbances guests may experience. We won't offer additional compensation for construction disturbances. We apologize in advance for any inconvenience.

Kadenwood Gondola hours. The Kadenwood Gondola operating hours are 8:30 am - 8:00 pm daily, as of December 13, 2022. Kadenwood Gondola hours are seasonal with longer operating hours during peak periods.

View an interactive Kadenwood Ski Access Map, with all our homes listed and the location of the private Kadenwood Gondola.

Cameras. Please note there are exterior cameras installed at the front and rear entrances of the property.

On this top floor you will find three more bedrooms, one with a queen-sized bed and ensuite, and the other two with two twin beds that share a bathroom.

Continuing onto the bottom floor there is an additional bedroom with queen-size bed and ensuite with a deep-soaker tub and separate glass shower. Finally, in the furthest bedroom there is a bunk bed wall that can comfortably sleep four children. The room includes plenty of closet space and its own bathroom with deep-soaker tub and separate glass shower.

In addition to these private bathrooms there is a powder room on the main floor behind the living room and kitchen. This impressive home can easily sleep 10 guests with a maximum occupancy of 12.

Added Conveniences

The home‚Äôs steam room offers the perfect place to relax and rejuvenate after a day on the slopes. Store your ski and snowboarding equipment in the large ski room, complete with boot, glove and helmet dryer to warm your gear for the day ahead. A two-car garage and large private driveway offer up plenty of space to park your vehicles.

Location

This home is located in Whistler's Kadenwood neighbourhood, an exclusive ski-in/ski-out community that is surrounded by spectacular old-growth forests and provides access to its own private resident's gondola.

Things to Know

Booking requests. Please note that we do not offer instant booking on this property. Online bookings are considered booking requests and will be subject to review.

Ski Access. Ski-out access to the Lower Peak to Creek trail is available a short walk from Serenity's entrance and is weather dependent. The closest ski-in access is near the top of the Kadenwood Gondola. Ski access typically begins in late December and ends in March. The Guest Services team can confirm snow levels shortly before arrival.

Construction in Kadenwood. As one of the newer neighbourhoods in Whistler, several homes remain under construction in Kadenwood. The homesite next to Serenity is under construction. Construction is typically active from 8 am to 5 pm but is permitted from 8 am - 8 pm. Guests may experience construction noise from machinery, cranes, other construction-related vehicles and workers. During the summer months, we include a construction discount at the time of booking as compensation for any disturbances guests may experience. We won't offer additional compensation for construction disturbances. We apologize in advance for any inconvenience.

Kadenwood Gondola hours. The Kadenwood Gondola operating hours are 8:30 am - 8:00 pm daily, as of December 13, 2022. Kadenwood Gondola hours are seasonal with longer operating hours during peak periods.

View an interactive Kadenwood Ski Access Map, with all our homes listed and the location of the private Kadenwood Gondola.

Cameras. Please note there are exterior cameras installed at the front and rear entrances of the property.
sectionedDescription.summary: Welcome to the grand Serenity Estate. This impressive ski-in/ski-out home is perched high above the valley in the exclusive Kadenwood neighbourhood.

sectionedDescription.access:
The cottage has ample parking. There is no garage. But the driveway is long and you can park your cars there without any issues.
The cottage also has an alarm system and cameras on the entire outside perimeter.

There is also a main floor master for older guests that have mobility issues
sectionedDescription.description:
The unique "Timber House"- Gorgeous lakefront 4 season cottage just 15 min north of Huntsville.

Very close to the beginning of Algonquin Park and with access to year round amenities, this is the ideal cottage experience for friends and family.

The cottage features 5 bedrooms with 6 queen beds and 3 full bathrooms. The walkout basement has a game room with a pool table and air hockey and tons of board games. It also has a study with hi-speed wifi so its an office away from home.

More pictures coming...The cottage has gorgeous architecture where its a timber and pin built frame. Its very rustic yet modern with all the amenities you need. The main floor has cathedral ceilings with a living room and a TV room. The TV room is attached to a Muskoka room (which is 3 season since its screened in but open). The kitchen and living room both open up to the deck which has the BBQ. A few short steps and you are on the lower deck area overlooking the lake. The lower deck has stairs that lead right down to the lake. In the summer, there are plenty of activities like swimming, canoeing, and paddle boarding. In the winter, once the lake freezes over, its great for ice skating. But watch out for water currents and the thickness of the ice.
Its only 15 minutes from Huntsville which gives you access to grocery stores and all other conveniences as well as the ski resorts.
And finally, this is at the very beginning of Algonquin Park which is the largest provincial park in Ontario. So countless activities available including hiking.

The cottage has ample parking. There is no garage. But the driveway is long and you can park your cars there without any issues.
The cottage also has an alarm system and cameras on the entire outside perimeter.

There is also a main floor master for older guests that have mobility issues

New ownership of the cottage so all furniture, mattresses and linen are brand new and the cottage is in immaculate condition.

Please ensure that you pick up after your pets around the property and do not let them soil indoors or sit on the furniture. If someone is bringing pets, a special cleaning fee will be collected at the time of booking.

reviews.comments:
We stayed at Chen‚Äôs condo for 8 nights. The Condo was very clean, beds were extremely comfortable, and had all of the amenities of home. We brought our 1 year old and she adjusted quickly because there was a high chair and pack-n-play already provided. Parking in the garage was also nice to have and would be great in the winter. We also enjoyed walking around the property down by policeman‚Äôs creek.
Thanks for a great week!

The condo is just as described and pictured. The amenities and appliances are great, the space is very comfortable to live in, and the surroundings and location is breathtaking. The host is very responsive, helpful, and informative. Would highly recommend!
Owner was extremely responsive and helpful.  The condo was absolutely pristine!  Decorated beautifully and the location was right in the heart of things.  You won't regret choosing this place.
Beautiful spot - we will be back!
Best AirBnB I‚Äôve ever stayed at‚Ä¶.place and location was absolutely perfect.
Great host, fantastic unit with a spectacular view. Will definitely stay here again.
All amenities are the best quality with detailed instructions. The place is elegant and cozy. The host is informative, responsive, and helpful.
everything was really great.

This place was absolutely breathtaking! Aside from the gorgeous view, it also had everything we could want or need in a place to stay.
Location - amazing. Everything we needed to get set up for our stay was close by, with grocery, liquor store, and restaurants within a very short walking distance. Close by to beautiful trails and scenic spots.
Amenities - the place was spacious, washrooms were large, kitchen had all the comforts of home, hot tub was a bonus, and balcony was a beautiful place to have morning coffee. It was awesome to have laundry facilities as well.
Cleanliness - the unit was so clean it looked brand-new. It was comfortable with tons of space for our group of 6 people.
Host - Chen was so responsive and great at answering our questions. Check-in and -out instructions were very clear and easy to follow.
In summary, an amazing spot. We will definitely be back!
This stay was fantastic. Chen was very attentive and responsive. The place was clean and the location is gorgeous.

sectionedDescription.description:
LUXURIOUS CORNER PENTHOUSE. Majestic vaulted ceiling. Spacious living space. Fully equipped gourmet kitchen. Features 3 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms. Sleeps up to 10 guests. Underground heated parking lot accommodates two cars (tandem parking). In the heart of Canmore. Close to everything. 20 minutes drive to Banff. 1 hour drive to Lake Louise.

**Parking stall can park two vehicles. (See "Other things to note" section for more details)
**Hot tub opens daily from 8AM to 9PM. Booking is required before each use (30 mins per use) through a dedicated booking website.

This 1,600 sq ft, 3-bedroom, 2-bathroom corner condo situates on the top floor of the White Spruce Lodge complex in the Spring Creek community.

Living room features majestic sloped high ceiling with two oversized grand windows offering lots of natural lights throughout the day. Breathtakingly surrounded mountain views is always a plus with a penthouse. Huge balcony accessed from the living room contains a BBQ grill and a set of outdoor sitting furniture.

Kitchen is fully equipped with high end quartz countertop, gas cooktop, major/minor appliances and all kinds of tools, pots and pans, allowing you to thoroughly exert your cooking talent and prepare your own gourmet meals.

Master bedroom offers a comfortable king bed and a four-piece ensuite bathroom with double-sink vanities and soaker tub. The second bedroom also provides a king bed. The third bedroom is set up with two full-size beds, along with a second balcony. The second bathroom is also equipped with double sink vanities. A washer-dryer combo also awaits to serve your laundry needs inside the condo. All of these features make the condo able to accommodate almost all types of groups.

2-car tandem parking lot (one parking in front of another) is located in the heated underground parkade, which is easily accessed through the elevator.

The complex also features a gym and an outdoor hot tub that open year-round for your enjoyment. 

The location just cannot be any better. Just as its slogan says, the complex situates in the absolute heart of Canmore, surrounded by woods, rivers and mountains. It also makes it convenient to go anywhere. You could walk to downtown in 10 minutes and drive to Town of Banff in 20 minutes. You would also have access to several hiking/biking trails without touching your vehicle.

I usually will not be able to meet guests but will certainly make sure that I am always only a text or a call away.

A detailed Unit Guide listing all necessary info will be sent to you through email before your arrival. My contact info is also provided for you to reach me in case you need any assistance during your stay.

Spring Creek Community is located at the very heart of Canmore. Quiet and peaceful.

** An Airbnb unit is different from a hotel room. This is NOT a hotel room. Please treat this condo with care and respect that you would with your own home. 
** Unit Guide that contains all information you need when staying in this condo will be sent to you before your arrival. We kindly ask you to review the Unit Guide in order to use the condo properly.
** Underground tandem parking stall, meaning you can park TWO vehicles with one in front of another. Parkade height clearance is 7'3" or 2.2 M.
** High speed internet wifi 300M accommodating your work-from-home needs.
** High chair & foldable crib available.
** Smoking in the unit is subject to $500 penalty(on top of extra cleaning charges).
** Partying in the unit is subject to $500 penalty(on top of extra cleaning charges).
** Having pet in the unit is subject to $500 penalty(on top of extra cleaning charges).

** Smoking, parties and pets are prohibited and subject to penalties on top of extra cleaning charges.

name: Mountain-Modern Chalet w/ Scandinavian-style yard

reviews.comments: We traveled with a large group of 15 friends, and this was everyone's first time to Whistler. What an amazing place! This home is spectacular and has every creature comfort you can imagine. The front and rear decks were amazing, perfect for happy hours and BBQ's at the end of an active day. The kitchen appliances we incredible making it super easy to cook anything just like you would at your own home. Easy walking distance to Whistler Village. We plan to come back to Whistler and this is the home we will stay in again!!! Highly recommended!

Beautiful house. Great Layout. Perfect for our group of 14!
They also recommended some great local chefs who came in and cooked for us in the evenings.

I've stayed in AirBnb's all over the world and I have a background in the hotel business. One of the things that's been sad about where Air BnB has gone in general is that the pictures rarely match the actual space. It's unfortunate but true.
However, in this case they matched perfectly!!
We were 10 people and we are thrilled at how clean and well appointed the place was.
The cold dip for the sauna is not actually available which is a bummer for hydrotherapy fans but that is the only thing.
We had massage therapists come to the house and made the place into our own spa for the weekend.

The place is perfect for larger groups who care about being comfortable and enjoy thoughtful design.
Thank you for the great stay, we'll be back.

Amazing house! No complaints there. It was great for a trip of 14.
My major concern was the level of service and lack of ‚Äúamenities‚Äù you would expect in a luxury rental (no trash bags, coffee, have to drive trash to facility, etc) for the amount of money you are spending.

While accurate, the pictures do not do this home justice.  Very nice home with plenty of private sleeping space, kitchen ware, and special amenities (steam room, sauna, hot tub).  A tad pricey and a bit more to do upon check out (remove all trash, wash all used towels, and start dishwasher) but then again, it may be part of the reason the home is kept so nice.  I would rent again.

Great location. Great amenities. Walkable to the village. Space for everyone. Really clean. Note that Whistler does not have trash or recycling pickup, so you must drop off (which is super easy). Also bring your own hand soap, paper products, etc. house has a limited supply.

Fabulous location for our group! Spacious but cozy, and very convenient! We loved the walks in the neighborhood trails and enjoyed the games. The dining table was wonderful for our large group, and there were more intimate gathering spots, too. We loved having storage areas for skis and outdoor gear that kept the living areas uncluttered. Great mattresses, too!

This place will take your breath away! This was the perfect home for our family getaway and it had everything we could imagine plus more! Would love to come back again to enjoy all the amenities again - the steam shower was my highlight for sure!
One thing I didn't realize, as I have never rented a full house in Whistler before, but you are responsible for removing all garbage and recycling from the home prior to your departure unless you are ok to be charged per bag. This was no sweat to our family though as the house has everything for you to stay organized and the garbage / recycle depot was only a couple of minutes away.
Thank you again - this was a very memorable trip for our family that we'll always cherish.

What a great home for small or large groups. We stayed for 4 nights and it was exactly as advertised. The home is close enough to walk to Whistler village and  has all the amenities one needs for a stay of any length. We would definitely re book this for any future stays in Whistler.

Wonderful place for a large group of people.
Plenty of room to hangout in a group or spend time in different areas in smaller groups.
Wonderful amenities for the post Ski/Bike/Hike adventurers or just to kick back and relax for your time there.
Walking distance to the village in all seasons and parking for those who drive.
Would recommend and stay again.

A newly renovated modern-style alpine chalet! We have a professional kitchen, master-bedroom steam room, a Japanese soaking tub, and 30" of sliding glass doors. We have a beautifully landscaped Scandinavian-style backyard equipped with an outdoor barrel sauna, hot tub covered by a gazebo, two outdoor fire pits with covered seating, magical elf-doors for children to discover, and a relaxation area with hammocks.

Self check-in

name: Entire Private Island + Lux Lakehouse w/ hot tubs

reviews.comments:
My second time renting this Lakehouse; I just love this propoerty. It was perfect for a winter getaway with friends. Such a warm welcome with fire in woodstove, champagne chilled (we were celebrating a birthday), chocolates etc...
We played pool, relaxed in the hot tub, did a magical day of snowshoeing on the lake and we lounged around in this cozy space. Tons of thoughtful amenities, interesting books, magazines, artwork...
Thank you Brad, you have a magical place!

I hosted a leadership retreat for a small group (total 6 people) at the property and it was perfect! As you cross the causeway onto the island, you get the impression you are entering a special oasis.
The views are beautiful, water all around, the sunrise and moonlight on the water were spectacular. The furnishings and amenities (especially kitchen) all very modern. I loved the decor, the artwork, and the books. We had all we needed for our group‚Ä¶high speed internet, Smart TV for easy connection, plenty of room to gather: for meeting, for meals and for lounging. The woodstove was perfect for chilly November and the Sonos speakers were spot on for good vibes.
The robes, the aromatherapy products throughout the house‚Ä¶all luxurious touches that make the property even more high end and unique.
Communication and check-in were very easy, lots of special and kind welcome touches that were appreciated. Highly recommend!

Amazing spot with great access to the water.
Large deck with lots of room inside.
They have everything you need including Bluetooth speakers to sunscreen.
We loved every minute of our stay and didnt want to leave,
We were a large group of friends and there was room for everyone.
Highly recommended.

photos.caption: Your very own private island as seen from the sky. Enjoy the entire island for the duration of your stay. Disconnect and recharge at your leisure!
360 Degree water views and 3 expansive beaches.
The Owner's Suite and its expansive tub overlooking the lake.
Lake life: swimming, fishing, kayaking, canoeing, or boating: define YOUR lake life at Limitless Island.
Enjoy a friendly game of pool, darts, chess, or take out some of the board games. The Games Room is perfect for a rainy day or colder evenings.
The bookends of every day on the island are breathtaking and joy-inducing. Energize for the day with sunrise yoga and get the wood ready for an evening bonfire - the island is yours and yours alone.
5 Bedroom, 3,500 sqf  Lakehouse with water views from every window! Host your friends and family or indulge in the intimate getaway of a lifetime.
Read, chat, or relax with a view! Enjoy the shade on hot summer days and immerse yourself in the expansive view of the lake. The furniture is sturdy yet light, so customize your deck as you see fit!
Beautiful nature, gardens, and wildlife for you to explore.
Make your lake getaway complete with a bonfire under the stars.
Stunning scenery during every season! Whether you're looking for a summer paradise or the coziest of fall escapes, Limitless Island awaits.
Wine and dine overlooking the water.
You'll be looking forward to rainy days in the games room! Pool, chess, boardgames, books, records - enjoy the view and stay dry while you play the day away with a cocktail from the Eagle's Nest bar!
We strive to tailor every stay to reflect the desires and personalities of our guests. Signature champagne upon arrival is just the beginning.
There's always something to discover on the grounds of the island. Wander and explore to unveil a world of natural magic.
The tallest tree on the island is also home to a couple of bald-headed eagles. Look up!
From June to late August, the lake is as warm as a pool and perfect for swimming.
Rocky Beach is the best point to admire the sky and hear the waves on windy days.
Indulge in any amenities that grab your attention. Be sure to let us know about your favourites!
Relax in a jet tub under the skylights.
Discover the benefits of a relaxing environment one day at a time.
Take some time to enjoy nature and its creations, indoors or outdoors.
Wake up to the sounds of the lake in the Captain's Room.

Shared between the Owner's Suite and the Fishing Room, the second floor bathroom boasts a jet tub and all the relaxation essentials. You'll love decompressing in a bubble bath looking up at the stars.
Wash your troubles away in the first floor walk-in shower.
The first floor's main bathroom has everything in place for you to look and feel your best.
Lovingly referred to as the Fishing Room, this second floor abode overlooks the garden and has its own indoor mezzanine overlooking the Games Room.
Catered or prepared by you, the kitchen is where the magic begins.
Cook, chat, and plan the day around the island.
Did you know? You can see the water, in full or in parts, from every window in the house.
Relaxing and decompressing have never looked cozier.
Warm up or cool down while enjoy the view of Grand Lake from the Owner's Suite.
Queen size bed for a royally satisfying sleep.
Enjoy the outdoors while staying in by lounging in the sun room.
The main room was the entire house at some point. Today, it is the centre of the house where everyone is naturally drawn to gather.
Relax by the fire or enjoy some reading time.
You can host dinner parties directly from the Games Room, next to the bar.
The Eagles' Nest Bar - what can we get for you?
On your way into the Summer Suite.
Rustic and elegant, the Summer Suite has one of the best views of the lake. Wake up with the sun and let the day work its magic.
The library has a quaint selection of books, records, and of course a TV with all the mainstream services for leisure time.
Smaller group? Enjoy the main room's dining space.
The 6th bedroom can accommodate 2 kids or 2 (not too tall) people.
Immediately next to the pool table, you'll find a half bathroom. Don't look for a light switch - the power is on the mirror and the light comes from both the frame and the person looking in.
Create warmth and ambience with the fire bowls on the Sunrise deck.
Enjoy the day and every angle of the sun on the Sunrise Deck, overlooking the lake and the endless sky.

sectionedDescription.access: The entire island is yours including the 6-bedroom Lakehouse, dock, private gated causeway, and all of the natural areas.
sectionedDescription.description:
Escape to east coast paradise as you rent your own entire private island on.

The stay of a lifetime! Enjoy 9 acres of rugged wild nature while indulging in modern luxuries on your very own private island!

The Lakehouse: 6 bedroom 4,500+ sf for up to 12 guests , water views from every window, high speed wifi (Starlink), 3 length boat dock, large decks on front and back of house, beaches, 4 TV's, fire pit, newly upgraded kitchen, whirlpool tub, bar, and brand new for the 2022 season - a hot tub!

"As seen in Private Islands Magazine. "

You'll love private-island living! 

Imagine staying on your very own private island for as little as $250 / night per guest! A travellers dream come true! 

- 9 acre private island 
- **New in 2022** - brand new Muskoka model hot tub from Canadian Spa Co. 
- Private access via gated causeway (NO BOAT NEEDED to access ) 
- 4,500 square foot custom built Lakehouse for up to 10 guests  (2 floors)
- Custom built by extraordinary carpenters the Lakehouse is constructed primarily of pine and is original to the island but has been dramatically modernized
- Beaches across the island  + great freshwater swimming + watersports 
- On the grid (complete with electric car charging station)
- Wifi connected (1X Xplornet network and 1X Starlink network great for working remotely) 
- Modern kitchen with stainless steel appliances and granite countertops
- 4 flat-screen TVs with Netflix and Disney+ 
- Daily housekeeping available 
- Antique pool table (play to your hearts content) 
- Chess & checkers table 
- Fully automatic coffee, espresso, and latte / cappuccino machine
- Dart board 
-  Expansive Sunroom 
- Custom built bar (locallymade of recycled pallets) 
- Outdoor fire put with Muskoka chairs 
- Front deck(2 levels) with brand new furniture 
- Back deck (one level) with BBQ and table for 4 
- Indoor fireplace / wood stove 
- Air conditioning (3 heat pumps / AC units + electric) 
- Washer & dryer 
- Whirlpool tub with air jets 
- Exercise equipment (weights and elliptical) 
- 10 acres of rugged nature and wildlife 
- Extraordinary fishing 
- Boat dock 
- Boat slip

The entire island is yours including the 6-bedroom Lakehouse, dock, private gated causeway, and all of the natural areas.

You'll enjoy an extraordinary experience from booking to checkout thanks to our award-winning hospitality team.

- Completely private island 
- Located on freshwater lake (brackish) connected to the world
- Connected by private causeway (no need to arrive by boat) 
- Only 25 minutes from an international airport 
- Only 30 minutes from nearest urban City centre
- Only 8 minutes to nearest convenience store, liquor store, and 2 take out restaurants ( seasonal )

Ample parking for up to 20 vehicles and one indoor EV charging station

Special Events & Weddings 

The property limits weddings, corporate events, retreats, team building, fundraisers, launches and special family events  to a maximum of one per month on a first-come first-served basis. Now pre-booking for summer and fall 2023.

Special Event Fee: Aprox $7,500+hst (in addition to a 3 night minimum booking of the island) 

 Special Optional Amenities Available at Additional Costs: 

- Tent Rental 
- Private Chef / Catering Service 
- Jet Ski Rental 
- Professional Fireworks Display 
- Private Events
- Luxury Transportation 
- Live Entertainment 
- AV System
sectionedDescription.houseRules: In the event of international travel from the US here to Canada that is impacted by COVID-19 - dates may be rescheduled no less than 30 days prior to the first date of booking (6/25) if US and or Canadian borders are closed or covid restrictions preclude use of the island for that date. Island will be offered for the future dates at the same rate of the date of booking

name: sleep 22, 10 br  7 baths, hot tub, lakefront, view

reviews.comments:
Our visit was nothing short of magical. I am getting married at this stunning property next August and Marla, knowing I wanted to plan out where my friends and family would stay while we were here, gave me an incredible deal to come up with my mom and grandma and stay at the Great House and look at all of the other cottages while I was here as they weren't rented due to low season. The energy of the property and each cottage is so pure and relaxing and warm.
Staying here for a weekend in the low season is awesome because we had the whole place to ourselves. I'm so excited to come back in the summer as the beaches look beautiful, perfect for swimming and we can't wait to rent boats and go fishing!
I can‚Äôt believe that I found this gorgeous gem of a property. It‚Äôs been a dream of mine to get married on a lake surrounded by the love of my friends and family and it‚Äôs almost as if I manifested this place because every single corner is exactly what I hoped and dreamed of. The design details, furniture, accessibility, landscaping and more are all so well thought out and developed with maximum ease and enjoyment in mind.
Marla and her amazing team (Sherri, Martha and George are those I've met thus far) and incredible. Always so helpful, quick to reply and just genuinely great people who want their guests to feel happy and at home.
Every house is sparkling clean, modern, has fully equipped kitchens, bright beautiful living spaces, comfy beds and multiple bathrooms. They all have lake access with stunning views that make you go, "Ahhhhhh!"
My grandma and mom are in awe of this place too (we didn't want to leave) and I think we might make an annual family trip of this every October now!

primaryHost.about: a psychologist who loves interior design. I live in Philadelphia and have 2 grown children and 4 grandchildren under the age of 4. I have a vacation rental compound on a wilderness lake in canada that has 5 houses, one just built, and hosts weddings and retreats. I have a condo in Miami Beach and property in Philadelphia. I love creating wonderful memories for my guests.

sectionedDescription.description:
You will love the Great House. This year-round-open house has six bedrooms and five bathrooms. Entertain a big group with our catering kitchen with eight burners, two wall ovens, two Bosch dishwashers, and two refrigerators.

Eagle's nest has an awesome view from totally renovated 4 bedroom 2 bath house. Front is all glass facing large private outdoor area and the lake. Kitchen is fabulously equipped- dishwasher, large fridge with ice-maker, electric ice cream maker.

The Great House:
The glass wall-in dining room fully opens to a screened-in porch creating an area that seats 40 people.

There is a deck and another kitchen and living room on the second floor. The main living room has both a wood-burning and a modern Malm gas fireplace.

A bathroom and bedroom on the main floor is accessible.

Eagle's Nest:
Just renovated gorgeous 4 bedroom 2 bath cottage, 25 feet of glass fronts the lake, large private area in front of cottage, 3 bedrooms have private verandas, 3 bedrooms have king size beds that separate into 2 extra long twins, new modern kitchen with large refrigerator and dishwasher, full size washer/dryer in unit. Fish cleaning hut. This is a fisherman's paradise but nice enough to bring the family. The swimming is incredible. There is a kayak, canoe and paddleboat for your use and you can rent a little fishing boat from us, a pontoon boat or a speedboat. If you need more space, you can rent one of the other cottages next door. The lake is feet away and we have a sandy beach and a boat launch.

Call or email for availability

name: Stunning Luxury Lakefront Villa on Lake Muskoka

reviews.comments: Renting from Paula was an absolute pleasure, she is an incredible host, has amazing communication and she really went above and beyond to make us feel so welcome and at home at her cottage.  The cottage is very well equipped and is extremely clean and well cared for. We would highly recommend renting this property.

Beautiful property, tons of space, impeccable views, water toys, amazing sandy beach, dock that can accommodate two boats, completely clean, couldn‚Äôt ask for more.
We rented this cottage for our grandmas 98th birthday. It was perfect for her with a main floor bedroom and bathroom. Paula was so responsive the entire weekend and the week leading up too.
Would love to come back! Highly recommend.

Welcome to Paradise and the magic of Muskoka!  Our family of 12 recently spent an idyllic few days in this most beautiful cottage setting, which offers everything from tanning on the large dock by day and star-gazing at night, or swimming, kayaking and paddle-boarding around the gorgeous lake, to elegant outdoor dining under the trees, feasting on S'mores around the firepit or simply cooking up a feast in the Chef's kitchen.  The grounds are well lit-up at night for an easy walk to the dock or firepit.  The beds are divine!  All of this would not have been possible without the kindness and sincerity of our host, Paula, to whom we say thank you, this was without a doubt our best vacation ever!

The property and space are simply remarkable! Absolutely worth it for anyone looking for an extremely well maintained, fully equipped and beautiful property for a larger group, located right on the water with also lots of green space. All of the bedrooms are also top notch + amazing kitchen with everything you need.
You also couldn‚Äôt ask for a better host in Paula - great communication, extremely friendly and generous with her time & home. Would highly recommend to anyone!

Not only was the cottage stunning, clean, and the perfect location, but Paula was the best air bnb host I have ever encountered. Our stay was beyond what we could have hoped for all thanks to her generosity, incredible communication and of course immaculate cottage. I cannot say enough good things!

We had a great family holiday here. The cottage is beautiful - good sized bedrooms, with comfy mattresses, new bathrooms, a great kitchen, huge dining table, and very comfortable living space; the waterfront is lovely - with ample seating on the dock, as well as a shady seating area closer to shore; and then there was the most comfortable porch, a large outdoor grill with an outdoor dining table, and a fire pit. The grounds are lit at night so you can find your way to the fire pit for s‚Äômores, or dock for star gazing - and we did both!
Paula is attentive and responsive, and had the place perfect for our arrival. Thanks!
amazing cottage

You will not be disappointed in this cottage it has every amenity you could possibly want and then some. The dock and toys to use make life at the water fun. Combine that with the shallow sandy bottom it is great for the. kids. Best of all Paula is one of the best hosts we have ever had and she is extremely responsive and has one goal and that is to make your trip an amazing experience.
Al and Sue - Naples Florida
Charming clean home with great comfortable beds, a wide variety of amenities and plenty of spaces for group gatherings or quiet contemplation and summer naps. Highly recommended.

The hosts and property are absolutely spectacular! You will be lucky to ever stay here. We had a very small, intimate family wedding, and it was the most special weekend of our entire lives. The cottage, space, property is absolutely remarkable. The hosts were detailed oriented, extremely thoughtful, attentive, and welcoming. We are happy to ever contacted to review how amazing our stay was. We thank Paula and her family so very much!

sectionedDescription.description:
This 4-acre retreat is nestled between Bracebridge and Port Carling. With lush greenery, peaceful lake views, and breathtaking sunsets, this property offers the perfect escape. Enjoy all day sun on your private dock, surrounded by a shallow, clear, and sandy shoreline. The cottage boasts 3900SF of living space w/6 bedrooms +1 futton, 3 baths, and a Chef‚Äôs kitchen. Close to amenities (golf/ski/tubing/hiking). This is our forever home. Welcome to Serenity.

First Floor: 
     Kitchen, Family Room (+TV), Sitting Area(s), Dining Room, Laundry Room (2 Washers + 2 Dryers), Bedroom 1 (+TV), Bathroom 1 (Stand-Up Shower)

Second Floor: 
     Bedrooms 2 (+TV), 3, 4, 5, Bathroom 2 (Stand-Up Shower)

Third Floor: 
     Bedroom 6, Futon, Seating Area (+TV), Bathroom 3 (Tub Shower Combo)

Property: 
     Gentle slope with wide stone steps down to the lake; large dock with couch seating, lounge chairs, and umbrellas; green space; gravel driveway; dining area with BBQ; covered front porch with seating; fire pit

Amenities Inside: 
- Board Games 
- Cards 

Amenities Outside: 
- Kayaks (2)
- Stand Up Paddle Board (1) 
- Bocce 
- Horseshoes
sectionedDescription.houseRules:
THIS IS A FAMILY COTTAGE. NO DRUGS OF ANY KIND ON THE PREMISE. NO SMOKING INSIDE. NO PETS ALLOWED. A FEE WILL BE CHARGED TO HAVE THE ENTIRE COTTAGE CLEANED BY A PROFESSIONAL COMPANY, IN ADDITION TO THE BASE CLEANING FEE.  

SHOULD YOU CHOOSE TO SMOKE OUTSIDE, DO NOT THROW BUTTS ON THE GROUND. IF ANY BUTTS ARE FOUND ON THE PROPERTY FROM ANY SMOKING MATERIAL, A $500.00 FEE WILL BE CHARGED TO GUESTS FOR CLEAN UP. 

IF THE NUMBER OF GUESTS EXCEEDS THAT WHICH WAS DISCLOSED UPON BOOKING, A FEE OF $300.00 PER EXTRA PERSON WILL BE CHARGED PER DAY.

UPON ARRIVAL, PLEASE SEE COTTAGE MANUAL FOR ADDITIONAL RULES.

name: LUXURY CONDO, 2 BEDROOMS, 1 BATH, SLEEPS 5

reviews.comments: Robert‚Äôs place was comfortable and the location was beautiful. We were disappointed that the hot tub was not functional during our stay, but Robert kindly offered us late checkout as compensation. The condo had comfortable beds and a well-stocked kitchen. We did feel that some of the appliances could use updating, and it would have been nice to have shampoo/conditioner provided. We also had to buy more toilet paper as there was only a couple rolls in the bathroom. Overall though it‚Äôs a very nice place and can‚Äôt beat the location right by the lake, and having the pool steps away from the patio was awesome for our kids!
reviews.response:
Thank you for your review and feedback. I try keep updating all of our places, but can't do all at once. Just got a new dishwasher for the condo today.
As well we advised the cleaners to leave more TP out in the future.
Hopefully we can welcome you back again.

reviews.comments: Great location.

We have stayed in this complex several times in different units. This unit was by far the nicest. Very clean and comfortable with everything you need including a great spice collection and comfortable bedding. Robert was always quick to respond to my questions and made the rental process very easy. I would highly recommend this host and suite :)
reviews.response:
Thank you Leah
Hope to welcome you and your family again

reviews.comments: Robert's place is great. It is roomy and well located. The master bedroom bed is very comfortable. The furnishings are nice overall. Large collection of dishes that are plentiful, but not all matching. No problem, of course. There are some cooking necessities like oil and sugar and a few spices. The living room is very comfortable. Great couches and big TV. Lots of books and games which we really enjoyed. There is a small dining table with two chairs, but an outdoor patio table that the five of us were able to sit around.  Really a great space. Very comfortable. Really nice pool, a very short walk to a small park and beach and great pier for swimming. The property backs up to an orchard with the mountains in the background. Stunning morning light to enjoy with quiet and a morning coffee. It's a great location for bike riding and walking by the lake. We would stay here again. Thank you, Robert!
Had a great stay, great location with access to golf, wineries and other amenities. thanks for allowing us to stay

If you want a floor level condo steps from a pool and in close proximity to a private beach... look no further! We had a wonderful stay. The master bedrooms bed is super comfy and the bathroom is very big! The second room has a bunk bed with mattresses that are not super comfortable for adults but would be perfect for kids. There is no window in this second room. The kitchen is stocked full of anything and everything you could need! Super great value for money! Would definitely recommend!
reviews.response:
Thank you for your nice review. Looking forward to welcoming you back anytime.
New mattresses for the second bedroom are bought already. I‚Äôll bring them there this October.
We just bought the place last year and will update step by step.

reviews.comments: Great location, lovely outdoor patio, and awesome pool!
Fantastic location and well equipped accommodation.  Excellent communication with the host.  Great family friendly place.
reviews.response: Thank you, looking forward to welcoming you back again!

reviews.comments: We loved our stay! It was very comfortable with 2 couples and it‚Äôs close to everything. The pool was amazing as well as the patio. We loved it so much we want to make it an annual trip!

primaryHost.about:
Hello, we are a professional workoholic couple. We hopefully can someday start to take off a bit more time and travel a bit more.
Our vacation home in Osoyoos is definitely our happy place and we enjoy the hot summers there. 

Offering the warmest climate in the country, mild winters and little precipitation. All surrounded by beautiful scenery and endless things to do for the outdoorsy type or just to relax in a small town setting renowned for its wineries and stunning views--known as the Wine Capital of Canada.

We are always available by phone, text or email. Any questions, please ask!

sectionedDescription.access: The whole condo
sectionedDescription.description:
5* RESORT 2 BEDROOM CONDO, ON CANADAS WARMEST LAKE

The resort is located on premium waterfront on Osoyoos Lake.This ground floor, poolside, luxury 2 bedroom condominium is tastefully furnished, with a PLASMA Queen sized bed ($3500.- memory foam) in the Master bedroom & custom built bunks in 2nd bedroom (ideal for a family of 4 or 5).  

Finishing features include:

Leather furniture, granite counter tops, hardwood floors, and tiled entrances. Flat screen TV's in living room & master bedroom.

This privately owned unit is fully-equipped. In the summer, lounge by the pool, enjoy the day on the 300 feet of private beach, or spend hours swimming in Canada's warmest lake.  In the Spring and Fall, enjoy wine tasting at the many wineries close by or enjoy a game of golf at the courses in Osoyoos and Oliver. 

Osoyoos, an Okanagan oasis, offers a year round playground for all ages. Endless water activities in the summer, winter sports at nearby Mount Baldy, year round golf, world renowned wineries, and an abundance of orchards -- all at your doorstep for you to enjoy.

The condo has it's own designated high speed Wifi.

Boat moorage is available for guests: $30 per day / $175 per week.

The whole condo

I'm available via phone / text or email if any questions arise.

For Snowbirds Osoyoos has become one of the top destinations in Canada during the winter months due to it's mild temperatures & low precipitation (which also means very little snow). Our little town is renowned for it's hospitality & friendliness & welcomes many of these people back year after year.

Our Conference Hall & kitchen is now available to rent for weddings, family re-unions, conferences etc.  It's available throughout the winter months for use by our Snowbirds for coffee mornings, card games & potluck dinners etc. The  onsite Spa is now open & offers a wide variety of services.

Some places are within walking distance, however a car would be highly recommended.

Please respect our neighbors!
Please no shoes inside
